column4: Your Scunthorpe store staff need a reminder of how to sort shelving prices.. Today I purchased some sale clothing and wanted to purchase a toy  on the shelf it was priced at £9  but at the checkout it was £18  when I queried it I showed the sales assistant the pricing but because opposite it there was same toy they just turned and said nope its £18 we better remove the incorrect price... All other reputable stores would have sold at price seen on shelf to the customer who raised the discrepancy but not yours  then to top it off after walking home I checked the clothing I had purchased to fins I had been charged full price for one item not the half price on the ticket... So all in all the last time I use Sainsbury  totally been put off..

column4: Don t Try to freeze fresh turkey fillets from Whitby Sainsbury. I bought some this morning from the chill cabinet and after reading that I could freeze on day of purchace I prepared to pack them for my freezer. When I opened the pack they were hard frozen at the core and begining to unfreez at the edges. I rang Sainsbury s and costomer services said that if I didn t want to use them they would give me a refund. Note the word If !  I would have liked to be told that they would check the chill cabinet and dispose of any semi frozen goods.  I would also like to be reassured that fresh turky has not be previously frozen and that this was a fault on the chill cabinet. Sign of the times I suppose   that they thought if I was given a refund other shoppers would not matter to me .

I rang Sainsbury s and costomer services said that if I didn t want to use them they would give me a refund. Note the word If !  I would have liked to be told that they would check the chill cabinet and dispose of any semi frozen goods.  I would also like to be reassured that fresh turky has not be previously frozen and that this was a fault on the chill cabinet. Sign of the times I suppose   that they thought if I was given a refund other shoppers would not matter to me .

column4: Hi! I ve noticed since your new range of spices came out all your fairtrade logos have disappeared... Ps love all your fairtrade products  it s the reason I shop with you every week!
column9: Hi. We've now heard back from our buyers. We have recently re-launched our herbs and spices range and still have two products in the range which are Fairtrade. These are: JS fairtrade ground black pepper 43g and JS fairtrade whole black peppercorns 45g. Previously we had other Fairtrade products in the range. Unfortunately these had proven difficult to source to a consistent quality and quantity which is the reason we have decided to review the Fairtrade products in the range. We are committed to source fairly traded products wherever we are able to do so; when we are able to meet our customer’s requirements regarding quality and availability. Thanks, Naomi.

column4: Question for Sainsburys regarding the till payment process for meal deals (not sure if any other customers have noticed this issue).  A few weeks ago I bought items that were definitely part of the meal deal and only after paying did I realise that no reduction had been made .  It was not much money so didn t make a point of going back to get a refund.  However having bought meal deals again 2 or 3 times since then I have made a point of checking that the deduction is made and have noticed that each time the full amount of the items is shown right up to choosing cash or card and only after going back one screen is the reduced amount shown (which I have then paid).  As I bought other items at the same time I am hoping Sainsbury s is not relying on people not noticing this anomaly.....???  This was not just within one store but across 2 or 3 different ones (in London).

However having bought meal deals again 2 or 3 times since then I have made a point of checking that the deduction is made and have noticed that each time the full amount of the items is shown right up to choosing cash or card and only after going back one screen is the reduced amount shown (which I have then paid).  As I bought other items at the same time I am hoping Sainsbury s is not relying on people not noticing this anomaly.....???  This was not just within one store but across 2 or 3 different ones (in London).

column4: Hi Sainsburys  I visited your Southampton Shirley branch today and was incredibly disappointed! I ve worked in retail for many years and the whole shop was just a mess  it was like the shop hadn t been faced up in the last week so the look of the shop as well as the fact customers were on their hands and knees to get products from the back of the shelf!  I m not quite sure what the issue is as the stock is there but just nothing happening with it! Also when I went to the delicatessen there was two members of staff  one serving and the other one labeling olives  when I stood in front of the one labeling I wasn t acknowledged at all so I asked if she was serving and she then said if you can just wait a minute which I wouldn t have minded if I was acknowledged in the first place.   I have to say I m extremely disappointed in the entire store and the way things are  would appreciate your earliest reply.
column9: Hi there, I'm very sorry about this Jonny! Could you confirm the products that were under stocked? Also could you PM me the name of the colleague in the delicatessen please? Robbie

column4: Literally just had the worst possible service with regards to my online delivery. This morning  I get a phone call from a Slough number. First of all  I am addressed as Mr  Rowan Britton - I am a Mrs. My account says I am female and so does the name on my bank card. Not impressed. After correcting her she didn t apologise. The woman says she s calling on behalf of Sainsbury s because the payment for my online delivery (expected at lunch time) hasn t gone through. While she s on the phone  I check my banking online - I have more than enough balance on my card. I tell her to try the card again. She does  it  doesn t work . She said she needs another card. I said I am not happy giving my card details out over the phone to a random company phoning me - she could be anyone! She huffs and puffs and reminds me that she is calling on behalf of Sainsbury s - I remind her that I don t know that. I can phone her and pretend to be whoever I want! I said if she already has the details I provided  she can try those but I am not happy giving any other details over the phone. Her attitude completely changes to really negative  and she then tells me I need to call my bank. My other direct debits have managed to leave the account with no issue  so I said there is no point. She then said  fine I ll cancel the order then!  And I said I suggest she does if that is the only option. She ended the call with  fine  bye!   If this is your customer service team  they need some retraining. I have never been spoken to so badly in my life. I understand that my card going through isn t her problem  but the attitude is her problem! I also don t think it is unreasonable to refuse giving a stranger my bank details over the phone. It wasn t even a Sainsbury s number she called from. I definitely will not be placing an online order via yourselves again.
column9: Sure - I'll PM you now

column4: I noticed today the the packaging has changed on your Sainsbury s Butcher s Choice Cumberland Pork Sausages x8 454g on inspecting the ingredients I was horrified to see that the meat content has dropped from 72% to 62% which represents a 13.89% REDUCTION in meat  however the price remains the same at £1.50. How can you justify such a huge drop in meat meat content without reducing the price? Needless to say I purchased a pack in the old packaging and unfortunately that will be the last time I purchase this previously meaty product.
column9: Nothing to do with BREXIT at all, this change will have been in the pipeline for months, they can't just change ingredients in days. but no doubt many unscrupulous companies will blame price rises on BREXIT.

column4: I ve just had an interaction at the store in Victoria station that has made me write about it.  I bought a bouquet of flowers on Saturday for my fiancé as I do each week. The bouquet was £12 with a 5 day guarantee for the flowers. On Sunday morning the rose heads had dropped and petals falling off  the other flowers in the mixed bouquet had gone limp and discolored. So this morning I wrapped them back up and headed back to the store.  I went to the cashier to explain what had happened at was honest in I did not still have the receipt but had the transaction on my phone app  had no price on original wrapping as who leaves the price on a gift?  The cashier was very friendly and called for the supervisor were thugs started to go down hill. The lady who came over did not smile once but looked annoyed  after I ran through again what had happened asking me what I wanted I said just a refund would be great. she walked over to the flowers and came back saying there was no bar code can she just give me £10 instead of £12? She also asked me what the expiry was on the flowers. If they where due to expire on Saturday or Sunday they should not have been sold with a 5 day guarantee on them.  She finally came over with items to make up £12  but not once in the interaction of customer service did she smile  apologies or make any effort to be civil.   The cashier though was lovely
column9: Hi James, sorry you've had this experience. I'd like to get this fed back to the store for you. Firstly, this was Victoria coach station in London? Also, did you happen to get the name of the supervisor? Or could you PM me a description so we can identify her? Thanks. Daryl

column4: Can you tell me if using my nectar card barcode in a phone app is actually against your rules please?    I m so fed up with cards in wallet and on key rings that I sat down and turned all my loyalty cards into digital barcode versions on my phone. Even though I showed her the nectar card with matching number from my wife s wallet!    Thanks

column9: Hi John. Yes, we don't permit the use of these apps in our stores. Unfortunately our scanners don’t work with Nectar cards in this format so customers are not able to use these in stores. Customers need to present their actual card or have their receipt validated to add the points the next time they're in store. Hope this helps. Maria

column4: Went to your Ashford Kent branch yesterday to buy your yummy vegan houmous wrap from the sandwich chiller  only to find it appears to be discontinued. This was very disapointing. It was the only reason I went in there. I won t buy vegan wraps from Tesco as they contain palm oil  yours didn t. However tesco do do a few other vegan ranges in their sandwich chiller  that don t contain palm  so it looks like I will be buying my lunch from there in future. When the world is becoming more vegan friendly  or dairy free friendly  this is a step backwards. Tesco are doing a very wide range of other vegan products (some that don t contain palm). Nearly all of your vegan products contain palm  this is why I do the majority of my shopping at Tesco. Many other vegans will also not buy palm oil products  even if they are using sustainable palm  as it is well known now that the sustainable palm industry has been lying in many cases  and that the industry is in turnmoil. Please use the many other oils that are available. A vegan would rather pay more for their food knowing that the world  animals & people had not been killed to make it. They would also rather their bodies be healthier and palm is one of the fattiest oils...Thanks.
column9: Sorry about this Claire. If you PM us your email address I can place a product request for you? Maria

column4: Today at 430pm my worst nightmare occurred  as I collapsed in Sainsbury s Lancaster and split my head open in the process. I would just really like to thank all the staff (and fellow shoppers). As I was shopping alone and suffered a head injury I was incredibly worried  but the people around me were truly amazing! They even put my shopping through for me and sorted it all before I was carted off in the ambulance. If any message could be passed on  I would really appreciate it. The staff members at the scene were absolutely wonderful and made what could have been something extremely horrific something slightly less scary. Likewise if on the off chance any Lancaster staff read this: thank you from the bottom of my heart (and I m sorry to whoever a jacket I ruined with my bashed up head!). Your staff really are a credit to your store and I will forever remain a loyal customer after this experience!
column9: I hope you're okay Gillian! I can see my colleague's replied to you on Twitter. Danny.

column4: I am so unhappy with the service I got or lack of service in the Irvine branch. Myself & my 3 year old daughter were in around 6:30pm tonight & I told her she could pick us all cakes as a treat. When we got to the bakery counter to pick the cakes 3 members of staff came out from behind the counter & started chatting in front of it making it very difficult to see.  When we had picked the cakes we wanted all of them walked away leaving me & my daughter stood at the unmanned counter. I stood and asked if they were seriously walking away when a customer was standing & they all just turned round & stared at me as if I was daft. I then walked away & 1 of the men found me in another aisle saying sorry he would serve me now. I explained that they had to be joking they blatantly stood in front of me when we were trying to pick out cakes then walked away as soon as we wanted served. He said he didn t realise I wanted served  surely the fact I was at the counter was enough of a clue that I wanted served.  I am not normally 1 to complain about things but I then had to explain to my daughter that we couldn t get the cake she wanted & it s also not the 1st time I ve had terrible service in this shop.
column9: Sorry you had such a poor experience Suzanne. Could you PM a description of the colleagues and the time you were in store? Leigh

column4: Thank you staff at Sainsburys Brentwood  today my new car locked itself with the keys inside. Fortunately I hadn t put my baby in the car as the car next to mine had parked too closely. On trying to open the car to put my baby in I realised it was locked with everything inside. Customer services were great allowing me to use the phone as much as I needed to get in touch with my partner and the duty manager then offered to order and pay for a taxi home and offered a drink in the coffee shop whilst we waited. Mum and baby home safely but a huge thank you to the care and hospitality of the store.

column4: my sister got em some clothes from you for my bday  she said i can change them at any Salisburys  is this true? I don t have a receipt  willi  still be able to change them?
column9: Without a receipt, I think it is down to the store to decide, Can you ask your sister if she still has it ?  You really need proof of date of purchase and also price paid , as Saintsbury's have regular offers and discounts on clothes. With a receipt you have 28 days to return items for refund or exchange.

column4: my sister got em some clothes from you for my bday  she said i can change them at any Salisburys  is this true? I don t have a receipt  willi  still be able to change them?

column9: Hi Naomi in that case can you explain why this item is in the baking isle amongst all the other food dyes and flavourings? I don't normally shop at Sainsburys as I have a Tesco and Asda closer. I happened to be near so thought I would buy all my baking supplies from Sainsburys for a change. I have never in all the years that I have been a baker found a food dye in the baking isle that isn't suitable for baking. That makes no sense whatsoever. It is misleading and I did not look at the back of the bottle. Why would anyone when this isn't a normal occurance with food dye. I am not bothered for a refund as it seems I should always read the labels on your products. I will ask that this product and any others like it are moved away from the baking isle so others aren't confused. Food colouring should colour the food not turn it white. I am very disappointed and will stick to purchasing my baking supplies elsewhere. Thanks for your time

column4: Salmonella recall! Very disappointed that Sainsburys won t consider that the Guacamole me and my daughter are on Monday may have made us I ll with a mild case of food poisoning!!! We ate the recalled product on Monday  by Tuesday morning I had all the symptoms of mild food poisoning and had to take the 2 days off work. My daughter had to stay home from school yesterday and again today. After wondering why we were both ill  last night I received the email to say that the  Tex mex dip selection  may contain salmonella! This made perfect sense to us as we were the only two in the family who ate the product!  Despite these facts Sainsbury have only agreed to refund the product and won t escalate my claim that the recalled product may have made us ill  as I do not still have the product to submit to testing. We are ill because we ate all the product therefore no I don t have the product to test if We hadn t eaten it all We probably wouldn t be ill!  Makes no sense!!
column9: Also I would have thought as you can see by my nectar card records I spend thousands of pounds in Sainsburys and do all my food shopping exclusively in Sainsburys Swansea marina that I would receive a bit more sympathy from the customer care team. Our symptoms were recorded at both my work and my daughters school before the recall was even announced yet I feel like it's being assumed that I'm just taking advantage of a situation, to be perfectly honest.

column9: Hi Rachel. Really sorry about this. Unfortunately, without a sample to test we cannot confirm if this is what caused your illness. Symptoms of food poisoning can take up to ten days to develop and can be caused by anything you've eaten during that time. We appreciate all customer feedback and have logged your comments with the relevant team for review. I hope you and your daughter feel better. Sam.

column4: I ve just left your newport Isle of Wight store with one extremely heartbroken 3 year old. We found a batman vs superman toy that he has desperately wanted for a while and have had no luck finding it anywhere else.  We went to use the self checkout  (to find no bags as you now have to ask staff for them but this hasn t been made very clear!) I scanned the item and it stated the item couldn t be found on the system and the assistant very vaguely said that we couldn t have it. She then asked the person on the customer services desk which she replied with the same thing.   I work in retail myself and if it was a product recall I would totally understand but it wasn t it was just not on the system  we have previously bought figures of the same collection from your store so don t understand it. I thought they might have called the customer service department to get some advice  as I would have done for any of my customers  but there was no attempt to rectify the situation.  So my son burst into tears and thinks that he s been really naughty and isn t allowed it because the lady s didn t like him! Some help would be appreciated here!
column9: Really sorry about this Bryony, I hope your son is okay! Can you PM a description of the toy and the colleagues you spoke to? I'll also need the time that you visited the store. I'll do what  can to help. Stephen.

column4: Remember me  a couple of months ago  I messaged you regarding a lady falling in your north cheam store  it took 20 mins for a first aider to some help  by which time myself and another customer stemmed her bleeding. I suggested you got more first aiders  you agreed!  On Friday  70th birthday  she went to collect preordered sandwiches from the north cheam store  she slipped badly on the soaking wet foyer floor. Once again it took a first aider 20 minutes to come as he was in a tunnel with no reception!!! I honesty think this unacceptable  my poor mum struggled her birthday party and all this week in agony  too stubborn to go to hospital but it s got to much for her and is going up there now.  I might aid also there was not caution wet floor signs up nor the rubber mats  but a remember of staff put them up after we left the store. Please get more first aiders!! You may live to regret it one day!!
column9: No not yet as my daughter is also very poorly so chasing around after her too, my mother is very hurt, enough for her to stop being brave and go to hospital. Will be in touch

column4: I want to complain!!!!!  Your white grapefruits are AWFUL!!  I try and start each day with half a grapefruit (so that s torture enough before we start!) but my attempt to be at least a bit healthy is not helped with both this and last weeks white grapefruits which literally had skin and pith over 2 cms s thick (yes  I measured it after grapefruit number 4 today - I am that sad!!). I almost break my nails getting into the things  they behave like Fort Knox!! Then there less fruit than inedible outer casing once you have broken into it.  Worse yet   they are 10p each more expensive than that  other  big supermarket . Please Aunite Sainsburys  fix this or I ll be forced to either defect to the Big T or go back to black coffee and a Curly-Wurly for breakfast!

column4: So shocked! I just witnessed staff throwing hundreds of cakes into a bin bag just before closing time (in front of customers) and when I asked the store manager if I could possibly take them for the children s home that I work in. For a garden party tomorrow. The manager refused  despite offering him a letter from the charity. He wouldn t even reduce them. Such a terrible waste of food & so disappointing. #foodwaste #foodwasteuk #stopfoodwaste #charity
column9: It was carelessly being thrown into bin bags during open hours & the staff member confirmed that it was being thrown away. Regardless, Sainsbury's policy is to donate at the managers discretion if you have a letter from a registered charity which I did. It's a garden party for 10-15 young people. So tight to refuse to donate a small amount of cake that's being thrown into bin bags in front of customers. Why didn't the manager just reduce them when I offered to pay for them? I find your response dismissive.

column9: Maryclare your customer service skills leave a lot to be desired. I would like to make an official complaint as although this is travelling across social media fast, you don't seem to be paying attention or taking it very seriously.

For a garden party tomorrow. The manager refused  despite offering him a letter from the charity. He wouldn t even reduce them. Such a terrible waste of food & so disappointing. #foodwaste #foodwasteuk #stopfoodwaste #charity
column9: Thank you Linzi, I completely agree. I'm really shocked to be honest. The response that we received from Tesco was far warmer and supportive. Xx

column9: I myself have the task of having to ask for donations for events and sainsburys have never once donated in all the years I have done it. Tesco and Morrisons do every time and always support us. Have a good weekend implied the conversation was over where as far as I can see she hadn't  actually started the correct conversation . Some people do get to have a nice weekend on their office 9-5 jobs with sharp dismissive comments where as others like us work tirelessly trying to improve the life's of children who need support for what ever reason. Keep doing what you do Laura and be proud you are one of those who care xxxxx

column9: Hi Laura, I'm very sorry for all the hassle you've encountered. The person you spoke with was a supervisor in the store. We'd like to arrange for the manager to give you a call and discuss what happened. We'd also like to discuss your charity and how we can support it in future. Can you please PM us the best contact number and time to call? Thanks, Stephen.

column9: Thank you for your message & for finally addressing this. I am happy to speak to the store manager, even though the 2 men that I spoke to both stated that they were store managers (There were around 3-4 staff stood behind them watching too). The charity that I work for has homes allover London. The home that I work in is in Camden. The Vauxhall store is my local branch, although I haven't shopped there since. I would prefer to speak to someone in head office & for this to be taken seriously please. Thank you for your kind offer of ongoing support for the charity. The issue isn't just about how the store dealt with this situation but about how you as a company dealt with it. I would like to know what you as a company can do. If you have food waste share it with charities, especially when they ask for your help. Thank you. Laura

column9: This is getting a bit ridiculous now. Can you actually read all of the correspondence pls? You've already offered to have someone contact me to discuss donations. We've been through why I don't really wish to speak to anyone at my local store (although I will if you feel it necessary). Why do you now need my full name & address? Surely a number will suffice? I'd like to speak to someone from head office & for them to explain what happened in store - why one of your supervisors/managers chose to throw perfectly good food into bin bags instead of donating to a charity, why he was so unhelpful and told me that it must be pre-arranged with head office yet you're stating that it's arranged at a store level. But when I went into store I was turned away quite rudely. I'd also like to know why your customer service on social media has been so dismissive & contradictory. Can you possibly give me a number to call? Or an email address to send my number to? This is really dragging on now... 😏

column9: Sainsbury's sort this out. I've had various different people reply on Facebook & Twitter over the course of 3 days & not one has offered a proper apology or a solution. I've been told publicly that donations must be pre-approved & then told that they are at the store managers discretion. I've been told that someone would look into this for  me, then told that it will be looked into internally. You are taking no responsibility and pushing it all onto the store manager by telling me just to go in & speak to him. Now I'm being asked for my number for the store manager to call me, despite telling you that I found him rude. Despite telling you that I find your social media responses rude & dismissive. Despite being shown up by Tesco, M&S and everyone looking at this feed. This is seriously disgusting. You've had 3 days to apologise & offer a solution. This is awful customer service. So disappointed by how you've dealt with this.

I received a phone call from the manager of the Camden Store asking me about an incident that happened in his store. The incident happened in Vauxhall as I've stated many times. It's getting a bit ridiculous now. Why did you offer for a member of the executive team to contact me & then when I gave my number told me that they are unwilling to take my complaint? Let me guess... You'll look into this for me & my patience is appreciated. Sainsbury's social media team you are embarrassing yourselves.

column4: I would like to confirm my absolute disgust has been received on your page.  As I can not see it. After visiting sainsburys on Elizabeth Street Victoria was followed around by security and after burping was told to shut up and be quiet. After saying how rude the security was  was then followed out to be called a faggot  a cunt and told if return when he is there i will be banned. This was a gentleman of age with a moustache. As a manager myself working with customer everyday feel this is absolutely disgusting and will be boycotting this sainsbury and any other ensuring my whole company  family and friends do the same. To be spoken to in that manner with such things going on right now with in the gay community feel that a company of such stature should be ashamed.  I will be sharing this and ensuring as many people as I can know the disgust I felt today.
column9: I am utterly disgusted as I came to visit my friend today for my birthday. Went to go and get food to cook us both a meal and left feeling not hungry and upset. In absolute shock and disgust.

column4: Hi Sainos.  I ve just been eating your taste the difference Indonesian tiger prawns. You can taste the difference. Normal prawns taste of prawns. These taste of absolutely nothing. Their vibrant colours are awesome  but this no way reflects the flavour - I feel hoodwinked with a hint of mild disappointment. Your prawns are normally great  I know you can do better than this  and I think you know too.   The cat enjoyed the rest of them if that s any consolation  but then  he does also like to lick his balloon knot.   Regards  Jon.

column4: Why have you started using oat flour in some of your gluten free biscuits? Not all coeliacs  especially children can have oats. Why don t your buying staff look into things properly. The damage it causes is terrible. It can take months to get back to some sort of normality  and the pain and suffering is immense. Please do something about it as soon as possible. Also let people know you ve changed the ingredients. This is really disappointing as all it takes is a little checking and asking your customers some basic questions. It s already extortion with prices we have to pay for free from products without getting sick from them too.

column4: Yesterday I went to one of your stores at Colchester avenue Cardiff. I had heard from a CMPA group on Facebook that you stocked dairy free birthday cakes which was a thrill to hear as my baby boy is allergic to dairy. Once there I was greeted by one of your employees who was so helpful. She showed us all your allergy free foods  even taking us over to the frozen section to show us your frozen free from all foods and ice cream. This lady was so kind and really caring and understanding towards my little boys needs and the information she gave us was fantastic. I hope she gets recognition and praise for her help yesterday. She has put me at ease of what I can give my baby and has made me feel more than welcome to come back. She is definitely top notch at her job. Her name was Sharon and she has a slight Liverpudlian accent. Thanks Sharon 😀

column4: Customer Service? My friend purchased a Television recently from the Rushmere  Craigavon store and unfortunately the Large Screen Smart Television (4K) was faulty. column4: Poor customer service delivered by Sainsbury s Chester this evening......... I had saved a couple of 50p off vouchers for PG Tips but when I presented them at the till the cashier noticed they had expired on 31/12/15. I assumed I must have bought the tea bags some time ago. I did however purchase a further 2 boxes yesterday evening and opened one when I got home. It had the exact expired voucher in it. I contacted Sainsbury Chester this evening and spoke to Cathy on the Customer Service desk. She was initially quite disinterested and suggested I contact PG tips. I suggested that maybe the problem lay with Sainsbury and their stock control. I didn t get the impression that Cathy was looking to provide resolution to my issue or in fact offer an acceptable level of customer service. I took a note of the telephone number offered and thanked her letting her know I would be sharing the detail on the Sainsbury s Facebook page in order that other customers were made aware. Her tune changed very quickly and a callback was offered. She returned to advise that the sell by date on these boxes were Oct and Nov 2017 and that they felt PG Tips had printed an incorrect valid to date on their vouchers. She passed me to her duty manager who said that their customer care team would be made aware and eventually took my name and told me I would be refunded the value of the coupons the next time I was in store. I am disappointed that no service at all was offered until I mentioned that I would be sharing the details on their Facebook page in order to make other customers aware of the problem with the coupons!
column9: I would have complained to PG

column4: I am once again disappointed that my local Sainsbury s (Pepper Hill  Northfleet) yet again has stopped stocking a product that according to staff at the store  sold out quickly every time it was stocked.  I am talking about 21 day aged rib eye steak available on the butchers counter.  It seems this was stopped being supplied a few weeks ago and someone somewhere has decided to replace it with Aberdeen Angus steak  which has no sticker to show how long it is aged.  It may be Aberdeen Angus  but I must admit that the steaks do not look particularly appetising  and from the colour of the meat it does not look like it is aged much at all.  Is this a policy decision nationwide not to supply 21 day aged steak  or has Pepper Hill been singled out for special treatment
column9: So how long is Aberdeen Angus hung for? I will no longer be buying meat from Sainsbury as ""simplifying the products available""  does not give customers choice, you are dictating what we can buy - or not

Danny.

column4: I have used your online service pretty much since its inception but have had enough. Last week you took over £90 from my account and it was expenditure I was not expecting. Firstly you took £60 payment for the renewal of a delivery saver pass which I did not want . Surely you should have to opt in to such things. I asked for a refund of this 6 days ago but no reply on this has been received to date. Secondly you sent a pack of 200 cigarettes instead of a 100 pack. I complained about this but your team seem to have missed the point that surely a better option would be to have sent single packs. They want me to return the unwanted ones but I can t split the pack. I was left with the choice of no cigarettes or 200 and as I couldn t get out of the house at the time I was left with no choice! All on all  it s very poor service and you do not deserve my loyalty.
column9: Sorry about that Sue. Can you PM your order number along with the contact number, email address and post code for the account. Thanks, Megan.

I don t appreciate being  told off  in your Wrexham store for allowing my toddler to sit in the small trolley. As a parent I understand that he could  at any moment  whilst being closely watched by both myself and husband have recklessly launched himself from said trolley and I am prepared to take responsibility for this  however  being 36 weeks pregnant and just trying to pay for my shopping I don t want an ongoing lecture verging on insulting from your cashier  just making the point once would have been sufficient but to keep going on about it was just embarrassing and irritating. And to say that it s a  food hygiene  issue when your trolleys are stored outside  in a car park  is frankly petty.
column9: Apologies for the experience Sarah. We encourage children not to sit or stand in the main shopping part of the trolley, this to ensure the safety of children & cleanliness of trolleys. However colleagues shouldn't be insulting. Can you PM us a pic of the codes at the bottom of your receipt? We'll log your feedback for the store. Thanks, Kirsty

column4: Just spent 19 minutes waiting to get through to customer services regarding my Sainsbury s Kitchen Collection Stand Mixer . I d  tried everything possible with it but am now stuck with all the ingredients ready to make a cake but can t as the mixer doesn t  work - it just flashes blue lights at me (so is clearly getting power). I m supposed to be taking the cake to a tea party for the 3 learning disabled young people I work with this evening. I now won t be taking anything as there are no shops near me to even buy one from! Despite my quoting the model & serial number & your customer services admitting it is faulty it seems Sainsbury s are unwilling to exchange   refund or do anything for me without the receipt or some proof of purchase. Since the mixer is Sainsbury s own make I couldn t have bought it elsewhere. I have no idea when I bought it. I have frontal lobe atrophy so am very forgetful. I suspect I bought it shortly after my mum died  - April 2015 - as I made loads of cakes with it for the reception after the funeral. I have no idea what I did with the receipt and can t remember if I used my credit or bank card. Either way I have online banking for both and it d be pretty difficult to identify which transaction it was included on.  So . In conclusion I now have a useless piece of junk I paid about £150 for  a kitchen full of ingredients I have no option but to chuck away & this evening there will be some very disappointed young people. I should ve learned from a previous debacle when I bought a cooker   washing machine & dishwasher that Sainsbury s seemed at a loss to manage to deliver & even when they finally arrived were damaged. So it s 2 strikes & you re out. I m not buying a single thing from Sainsburys again nor will I be setting foot in one of your stores.
column9: Ben Harris . Try having brain atrophy and Hashimoto's disease - I guess you're not dementia friendly either ! I'm not asking for a refund but for  someone to fix it or exchange it for one that works - I guess you can't read either ! That or you work for Sainsburys. Either way I want nothing more to do with either.

I understand this is frustrating, however you can certainly pop back into your nearest store to see if there's anything they can do for you. Leigh

column9: Sainsbury's . Thank you for your civilised reply. I would've bought it with other shopping so it won't show as a single item even if I can find it on my bank or credit card statement . Customer services said as it is the premium Kitchen Collection range - it's a big heavy beast - it has 2 yr warranty. I normally staple receipt to the instruction book as I have a brain injury so forget where I put things  but for some reason I haven't or it's got separated . I do remember using it to make lots of cakes for after mum's funeral so it's possible I bought it around then which would've been within the 2 yr warranty period .

Why or why does Sainsbury s de-list certain products?! I understand that they may be minority products (my examples are chilled beetroot juice and oat bran) but guess what  when customers like me find that they cannot buy their weekly staples from you anymore  we go back to shopping at Waitrose! So short sighted - Waitrose must laughing all the way to the bank.
column9: Hi Louise. Sorry you're unhappy. I can log a product request for you if you like? Which store do you shop in? Daryl.

column4: Why or why does Sainsbury s de-list certain products?! I understand that they may be minority products (my examples are chilled beetroot juice and oat bran) but guess what  when customers like me find that they cannot buy their weekly staples from you anymore  we go back to shopping at Waitrose! So short sighted - Waitrose must laughing all the way to the bank.
column9: Ah, I see. I'm really sorry Louise. It's frustrating, I know, but we base our stock decisions on demand; if something isn't selling then financially it's not something we can justify. I can completely understand how frustrating it is, though. If you've placed a product request already I could only recommend you wait and see if your products start getting stocked again. Daryl.

column4: I shop with sainsburys home delivery every week and have always been happy with your services  home delivery and in store. This I ordered a bottle of Jack Daniels Honey and unfortunately it was the wrong one. Our main sainsburys store is 6 miles away and I don t drive so I decided to return it to a sainsburys local store which is just down the road from me. Once I got there I was disappointed to be told that I could not return it to that store as they don t stock it. I really didn t understand this. I used to work in retail for many years and we would return anything that was purchased from other branches even if it wasn t stocked at our store! Now I have to spend my day off with a bus ride into Grimsby with here children to return it there. Very disappointed!
column9: Really sorry about this Kelly! Which store did you try and return it to? Did you get a name/description of the colleague in question? If so can you DM us it. The store can take the product back, but would need to have the product put onto the system to do this, this can take some time. I'll be sure to have this passed on internally. Faiza,

column4: Very upset customer. I used to buy your falafel and houmous wraps and recently I picked one up not thinking anything of it  ate some and thought it tasted strange only to realise you have put Mayo in them! I was so upset  I have been a strict vegan for years! There was nothing on it that says new recipe! 😒 I felt so ill afterwards especially because my body is not used to dairy also or egg! and what if I was dairy intolerant?! Or allergic to egg?! Could have been a serious matter! You have certainly lost a lot of vegan customers from changing your recipe! But to change it with no warning as well! Appalling and dangerous. So disappointed in Sainsbury s
column9: Sorry about that Amy, are you feeling better now? Can you please send me a pic of the barcode on the packaging please so I can get this fed back to the relevant team? Saira.

column4: Dear Mr or Mrs Sainsbury boss person   Just a little note as I would like to applaud the promptness of your home delivery service. Booked for 8:30-9:30 and arrived at 8:35.   The lady driver was extremely informative about her job status  apparently she feels she is treated like crap and as for my shopping  well she declared that she goes to ASDA as sainsburys are no good! She was Extremely enlightening on a bright Sunday morning about personal shoppers in store who collect the online orders too!   I would also like to thank you for my shopping in which almost every item was individually bagged in a nice orange carrier bag except randomly the bread and baked beans - possibly not a brilliant combination to bag?   Several short dates too within my shopping so given the packaging  short dates and overload of information from the driver  not sure I will be using Sainsburys again. Not really much customer care there 😔
column9: Hi Sarah, I'm really sorry about your experience. This certainly isn't the level of service we expect from our colleagues. Can you please PM us your account holder's name and order number? Did our driver make you aware of the short dated items? Thanks, Allie.

column4: I normally find the customer service I m your stores really good but today I was not impressed by how I was spoke to by a lady on your check outs. She was bitching to a couple in front of me saying  can you believe a girl I served had a my little pony tattoo on her chest! I mean come on A my little pony tattoo!!  I felt the need to respond because I too have a my little pony tattoo and her response was to ask me if I was a woman or a girl. I advised her being born in the 80 s I loved my little pony. Her response then was  I don t like tattoos at the best of times but defiantly not something as tacky as that!  How freaking rude can you get!!! I have worked in retail in the past and would never have dreamed about speaking to a customer that way let along slag a customer off to other customers. Not impressed at all  I m almost 34 and I ve never ever been spoke to like that by somebody serving me!!
column9: Hi Jen, I'm sorry about this. Which store was this in? Maryclare

column4: Would like to say a big thank you to the Chelmsford branches staff for being so helpful yesterday (at around 2.00pm) ! My nephew(1yr 9mnth) had the biggest hissy fit after he spotted his favourite yoghurts go into the trolley! Oh my what a tantrum it was! Not only did the customers who were also shopping  show nothing but love and no horrible looks  the staff went out of their way to help! A female worker of yours came over to us and tried to calm my nephew down by baby talk tactics  she then asked a male to stop doing what he was doing to open a till for me. He then helped pack my shopping. It really made all the difference! Thank you so much. A rare act of human kindness which is missed so much these days! Thank you.
column9: Noooo! I wish I had! It was around 2.15pm and I'm pretty sure she had glasses! She had a walkie talkie on her so assuming she is a supervisor? The guy had dark hair and three grandkids lol! He was telling me about them! Xx

column4: I was in your Swadlincote branch yesterday and as I was leaving  saw a young employee taking beautiful bunches of flowers and putting them aside  I glanced at the date and realised the were  today s dated  flowers... There was still PLENTY of life in then so I enquired if they were going to be reduced ( thinking I might snaffle a bargain) only to be told  no these are being  disposed  of.... I replied  what a shame  still lovely and fresh.... He then informed me  oh  don t worry  we donate them to local care homes free of charge!! Well done Sainsburys!!! What a lovely gesture.... #itsthesmallthings!!
column9: It is true. I worked on that department for a while and we take them to various care homes in our community 😊

column4: I would like to Thank Sainsburys for sending me a £10 pound voucher. This was  by way of an apology because on 15th June 2016 I purchased 12 maxi shakes which were all out of date in August 2015!!!  Yes I drank one and it made me sick! Thick lumpy and disgusting. I received a phonecall apologising too.  So much cheaper than a fine for them!!! £10 RECEIVED WITH THANKS BUT A PRETTY PATHETIC AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION.
column9: I think maybe letting stock going a year out of date and still selling it isn't quite 'ensuring the best quality' of your products? A best before date is a guideline for a reason! I'm sure we're all guilty of pushing it a few days or even a week but a full year is pretty rancid by anyone's standards? How was it not picked up on? Surely you have some sort of stock take/rotation or even someone thinking to double check these things when they're marking them down? It's a massive error had this have been a child's product it could have been a horrendous incident that could have even ended in a hospital treatment?  I'm not trying to start an argument with anyone but how can something a year out of date still be allowed on sale?!  Very worrying!

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  hello again. I was just enjoying some of your delicious fresh French Onion soup for luncheon  when I happened upon the list of ingredients at the back there. One of these ingredients  a sub-ingredient of the Balsamic vinegar  is  Grape Must Concentrate  (I m not making this up  can provide photo etc.). Can you explain why the grape needs to concentrate  and what the nutritional / taste benefits (or costs) are to me when it is concentrating vs when it is not concentrating? Under what other circumstances are grapes expected to concentrate  and are they known to be better at concentrating than other ingredients? At the risk of tarring them all with the one brush  can grapes even read? Is there a risk to the grape that overly long periods of concentration would lead to fatigue? Or does the person dictating the list of ingredients suffer from ADHD or similar  and was simply reiterating a mental note to themselves  which the typist took literally and wrote on the packaging? It s got me questioning the rights of grapes now - I d hate to think that the delicious grape that has given its life to my belly had to suffer unnecessarily in its last days.
column9: Hi Ken, I was under the impression the grape had a big exam coming up and needed to focus all its energies towards passing. After all, we need to ensure each grape has a University education in order to fulfill its abilities as a tasty, nutritious fruit. We would be doing a disservice to grapes everywhere if we didn't encourage them to concentrate their utmost in order to live up to society's expectations of them. Daryl.

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  hello again. I was just enjoying some of your delicious fresh French Onion soup for luncheon  when I happened upon the list of ingredients at the back there. One of these ingredients  a sub-ingredient of the Balsamic vinegar  is  Grape Must Concentrate  (I m not making this up  can provide photo etc.). Can you explain why the grape needs to concentrate  and what the nutritional / taste benefits (or costs) are to me when it is concentrating vs when it is not concentrating? Under what other circumstances are grapes expected to concentrate  and are they known to be better at concentrating than other ingredients? At the risk of tarring them all with the one brush  can grapes even read? Is there a risk to the grape that overly long periods of concentration would lead to fatigue? Or does the person dictating the list of ingredients suffer from ADHD or similar  and was simply reiterating a mental note to themselves  which the typist took literally and wrote on the packaging? It s got me questioning the rights of grapes now - I d hate to think that the delicious grape that has given its life to my belly had to suffer unnecessarily in its last days.
column9: A measured and thoughtful response, Ken. Those under-achieving grapes we use for the French Onion soup is part of a program to ensure each grape reaches its full potential, regardless of educational background. In this way, we can ensure a fairer grape society and work towards grape utopia in the future. If the cost of helping our grapes achieve maximum flavour is passed on to the customer, we would consider it a civic duty of sorts; a way we can all come together and do our bit for the grape world as whole. I'll have your thoughts fed back to the Head of Grapes for future revision. We appreciate your concern for grapes the world over. Daryl.

column9: Hi Daryl, I hadn't considered it from the civic duty angle, I'll admit. By educating them you ensure equality and that there'd be no grapes of wrath forming their own bunches, spurned by society. It seems I have misjudged Sainsbury's raisin d'être. I say, it seems I have misjudged Sainsbury's raisin d'être. Raisin d'être... tell you what, I'll get my coat...

column9: Hi Daryl, thanks for the prompt reply. Having thoroughly researched the issue, I notice that only the grapes in your soup (and balsamic vinegar) are expected to concentrate; grapes destined for other dishes are afforded freedom of thought, or indeed, permission to doze, while still becoming tasty and nutritious. From this we can ascertain that Sainsbury's is deliberately sourcing under-performing grapes for its soups (and balsamic vinegar), and is then having to fund their education in order to bring them up to par with your other grapes. This undue cost is being passed onto the loyal customer. I put it to you, that if Sainsbury's took the time to allow its better grapes into the soup (and balsamic vinegar), that customers would be able to pay the same price for the fresh French Onion soup as they can currently enjoy with the fresh (grapeless) Carrot and Coriander soup, which is 45p cheaper. Please pass this message onto your head of Grapes, thanking you kindly.

column4: Hey Sainso s! Do you think minimal interaction checkouts could be a thing? Maybe just one checkout where the staff don t ask you anything other than  do you need a bag?  and then take your payment. Not everyone likes  or is good at  small talk. Not everyone wants to be asked how their day has been every time they shop  especially if it s been a horrible day. Myself and quite a few friends dread the small talk that seems to be standard these days in supermarkets. We know the staff  lovely as they are  do it because they ve been told to be friendly but for an introvert it s seriously uncomfortable.

column4: Do not use #royaltaxis @royaltaxis in High Wycombe (also being used at Sainsburys as their taxi call point for customers) they ve made me wait half an hour for a taxi that was meant to be on its way  called to complain then called a liar and shouted at by the guy who is taking the calls. The taxi driver himself didn t even have the job booked until 5 minutes before he came to get me. I am 5 months pregnant and with a vulnerable adult doing their shopping. Absolutely shocking service and very rude! This has been logged with @sainsburys #sainsburys head office in London and an official complaint made as this was booked through the the in store  taxi call point  sainsburys are essentially advertising this company. Just got back and the driver took a wrong turn and then did a u turn in the middle of London road to on coming traffic  also then watched me and person I am supporting struggle with heavy shopping bags once at the address...even after I told him I am pregnant and need help with them. Let s hope that something gets sorted because it s terrible and left me feeling very upset and the taxi office clearly don t want to know.
column9: Hi there Bex, I'm very sorry about your experience. I've ensured this has been fed back to management in store. Debs

column4: I want to complain about the freshness of the groceries that I received on my most recent order (Ref: 29490952).   My order was due to be delivered on Monday 13th June but due to unforeseen circumstances  I had to put the delivery off for a day.  Groceries aren t cheap  which is why I shop on a weekly basis with either Sainsbury s or Tesco s - so that I have minimal waste.   However  last night I started to prepare a spaghetti bolognaise for my family and two guests but when I looked at the mince  it was brown and so I checked the date on the packaging to find that it was out of date by a day and on checking the mushrooms  I could see that they were  in the main black and so I had to throw both away too.      Instead I took the carrots and new potatoes out of the fridge to rustle something else up... and found that these too were a day out of date by a day and wet to the touch and so in the end  I had to pay out for a takeaway for us all  whilst this weeks fresh food order was nearly all in the bin... what a waste!  I don t know whether my order was left sitting in the van for a day  waiting to be redelivered or what the explanation is but this really isn t acceptable and I would like a refund.
column9: Really sorry about that Aimee. Can you PM the account holder's name, telephone number, email address and delivery address please? Amanda.

column4: Why are sainsburys strawberries grown in Kent marked British strawberries but the ones grown in Scotland are Scottish strawberries  are they not both British???
column9: Thanks Patricia. Our research has shown that, on products for Scotland, the Saltire has much more meaning regarding its place of origin for both our English and Scottish customers. column4: Dear Sainbury peoples   I found myself today with the strongest urge for some popcorn but being on a health kick I didn t want to purchase microwavable in a bag stuff ... I wanted the kernels in a bag that you put in the saucepan and salt yourself. Much to my dispair  I could not locate my desired item anywhere in Sainsburys in Bicester nor could 2 staff members  but alas  to my delight comes George the happy  smiley popcorn savior. I asked George if he knew where I could find such magical korn and George not only knew the aisle but the EXACT location and ascorted me there himself. George and his willing to help  can do attitude  saved me from a popcorn-less evening which would have been a travesty. So .... Thank you George from Bicester Sainsburys 😊✌
column9: So was I - it would have been a moody disaster had I not been able to.  I was in the store yesterday between 12 midday and 1pm.   Thanks Robbie!

column4: Can I ask why your petrol prices vary across Scotland in Edinburgh 105.9 per litre of petrol and in fife its 110.9 per a litre thanks X
column9: Hi Natalie. The fuel market is extremely competitive and prices are very volatile in the current climate.  Prices differ throughout the UK and you will see varying prices even between outlets owned by the same company. We want to ensure our petrol stations remain competitive within their local area, offering customers a fair price wherever they live. We therefore adjust the price at each station using locally gathered pricing information. We also run regular promotions on fuel including bonus Nectar points and money off per litre when spending a qualifying amount in our stores. Thanks, Naomi.

column4: Can I ask why your petrol prices vary across Scotland in Edinburgh 105.9 per litre of petrol and in fife its 110.9 per a litre thanks X
column9: No problem at all Natalie. Please don't hesitate to contact us in future. Naomi.

column4: Seriously unamused Sainsburys Pet Insurance increased the premium on our dog by 45% because she got a year older ????? She has been on their policy all her life with no claims. I have now moved all 3 of our pets to another insurance company saving over £300 a year with higher more relevant cover. Pity a bit of individual assessment isn t used instead of blanket judgements on these things. Never mind Sainsburys you have lost 3 insurance policies and have made a customer very irate at the whole situation. I don t care if the policies are managed by someone else it s got your name all over it. 😡🐶🐶🐱👎🏻
column9: Never EVER auto renew..loyalty counts for nothing these days...always shop around.

column9: Hi @Tammy, this company is unreliable, can't believe how they have knocked my confidence off the Sainsbury's brand. I am not willing to talk to 'customer service' or 'resolution team' anymore, if we could join together and complain to Financial Standard Authority (FSA) and Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) then it will stop them fooling and distressing people. I am certainly taking the legal route as my pet is suffering for 2 months now from life threatening disease and they are still 'deciding' wether to preauthorise her diagnosis....my pet has no history of illness and they are deliberately doing this to put us off. Worst pet insurance I have ever had, wish I stayed with Tesco. I am also involving media and BBC Watchdog to expose their real face.

column4: Hiya. Today I went to your Heyford Hill store with a friend of mine with special needs. We ve been here several times before and alway treated well - today  you re staff went above and beyond to make my friend smile! We had gone to Sainsburys not to do shopping - but to have a picture taken with a cardboard cut out of The Stig (we....I mean he  LOVES The Stig) as my friend has always wanted his picture taken with him. Well  when we get there we couldn t find The Stig anywhere.....a member of your staff called Jo said she would find it for us. She then spent half and hour searching for it through crates and crates of cardboard....when she found it not only did my friend get to give The Stig a hug but Jo let us take The Stig away!! I can not tell you just how much this meant to my friend! Your staff have made him so so so happy! Well done Jo an well done Sainsburys for having such amazing staff! Please ensure that ur sincerest appreciation are passed on to Jo! She definitely deserves some good recognition!
column9: Oh woah Sarah Jane, Heyford Hill's customer service is definitely in top gear! So glad you had such an amazing experience and got to take The Stig home! I've passed your comments to the store manager. Thanks, Maria

column4: To whom this may concern  today I visited one of your stores and was approached by a member of staff and was told not to plug my USB into the laptop I tried to explain that the reason I plugged my USB is because I am a ICT student and wanted to see if my website would fit on the screen I apologised and she continued to say no while I was attempting to explain and then said sorry in a rude manner and walked away I then asked for her name to complain she grabbed a colleague to try and back her case even though I didn t see this college while talking to the member of staff I then was approached by a manager and then this member of staff  said to the manager something along the lines of  I was messing with the computer I then tried to explain that the member of staff was rude to me he then continued to say you should not plug the USB into the computer I tried to explain that  I understand that now but the way I was spoken to was not right he had just spoken over me I then asked for his name and left the store and didn t want to get into a conflict the way I was treated is unacceptable and really unfair I expect to be treated fairly at your stores hope to hear back off you soon regarding this thanks  Harrison
column9: Sorry for the upset Harry, did you catch my colleague's name? I'll feed this back to the store. Chris.

column9: Martin Smith it's not the fact I used a USB that was the issue its the way I was approached about the situation I was spoken to rudely by staff I expect respect when I go to a store and if you was to think that well you are obviously childish yourself in no way would I do something like that thanks for the input anyway have a splendid day !!

Sainsburys   I ve just visited your Banbury branch in order to buy a Father s Day card  but not for my dad  my STEP dad  note the word step.  Of course this man isn t my real dad by blood  but this particular gentleman has been in my life for nearly 10 years  I m 24 this year  so just think  I was in school when I first met him  he s seen me move schools  to a completely different area of the U.K.  supported me when my mother wasn t there  bought me my first car  and treats me like I m his own daughter.   So what has saddened me today  is that I ve just spent 45 minutes looking through your selection of Father s Day cards  only to come out empty handed as you don t seem to stock anything related to a child/adult that doesn t live with their biological father  some children/people don t even know theirs. I m lucky that I know mine.   Yes  I know you stock generic  Happy Father s Day  cards  but I honestly don t think my stepdad deserves something generic  he deserves to receive a card that says  to my step dad  or  to the father figure in my life   a card that actually has a full meaning and means that I appreciate everything he does for me even though he genuinely doesn t have to.  Did you also know that everyday there are 1 300 step families forming  so I m not the only one in the world with a step parent. That s a very big number  so why have I found it so hard to find a card that tells that person how much I appreciate them and love them?   I also don t understand why you stock stepdad cards under your birthday range but not on Father s Day? Is that not a little backwards?   I suggest that instead of thinking that every family has a biological mother and father living under the roof  you think outside the box and cater to all types of families.   From  The Irvine/Finlayson family.
column9: Sorry you couldn't find something suitable Natalie, I completely understand your concerns. Step dads are just as important! If you PM us your email address I can log your comments for our buying team to review for next year. Thanks, Kirsty

column4: I do not normally do this but I am rather cross. I have just had a delivery from Sainsbury s  Letchworth  20% of which was either not delivered  or sent back. The ice cream was totally defrosted  almost to the point of being runny  but the driver argued with me - not a good plan! - and I sent it back. Apparently it was my own fault for asking for delivery without carrier bags! They had none of the perfectly normal  everyday milk I requested  and for the third time in a row  none of the dog treats I ordered. I did ring to complain  and the very nice man was apologetic and promised a refund and will recall the van as the refrigeration unit is obviously faulty etc etc.  To add to my annoyance they have sent me an evoucher for £13 that has to be used today! . Sorry Sainsbury s  not good enough  so my discontent is going public.
column9: Hi there, I'm sorry about this Stella! Could you PM me your order number and the name on the account please? Robbie

The ice cream was totally defrosted  almost to the point of being runny  but the driver argued with me - not a good plan! - and I sent it back. Apparently it was my own fault for asking for delivery without carrier bags! They had none of the perfectly normal  everyday milk I requested  and for the third time in a row  none of the dog treats I ordered. I did ring to complain  and the very nice man was apologetic and promised a refund and will recall the van as the refrigeration unit is obviously faulty etc etc.  To add to my annoyance they have sent me an evoucher for £13 that has to be used today! . Sorry Sainsbury s  not good enough  so my discontent is going public.

column4: I am very concerned because the price of your Basics Corn flakes has doubled overnight. There is No justifiable reason for this and it is irresponsible and cruel to people who have to budget very carefully who may depend on them as a key product. I would like you to ensure that this feedback reaches the highest level of the company.  Yours faithfully. Rowan Brook
column9: Sorry about that Rowan. We're committed to offering great quality food at fair prices which is sourced with integrity. We regularly review our prices to make sure we offer value for money whilst remaining competitive and we work hard to negotiate great deals with our suppliers. Although we try to keep our pricing as fair as possible sometimes prices can go up as well as down. There are lots of factors which can affect pricing, from rising costs of raw materials, to the production and packaging and even transportation. Whilst we try to absorb these increases for as long as possible, sometimes we eventually have to put the price up. Thanks, Naomi.

I am not trying to be dramatic but there are families out there who have to budget to the pence and a £0.10 increase here and there can perhaps be absorbed but to double the price will make a significant dent into their budget.

column9: You pay the price of the product in store on the day of your delivery.  So if a product was 89p when you placed the order, but is now 95p, you will be charged 95p for it, it's all in the terms and conditions.  THe price supplied when you check out is a guide price.

column4: Why do you stock so many products with palm oil in them? Most of it isnt labelled sustainable and anyway even if it was there is no such thing as the alleged sustainable is mixed with the blatantly not.I was trying to find a vegan  gluten free  palm oil free cake in yr store this week. They dont exist. Why is it ok to trash orangutang habitat. Do you know the females with babies get shot and raped by humans. You sell this just so people can have cakes with palm oil? And its not like there arent lots of oils you can replace palm oil with. Please give this some thought and get it off the shelves. You are colluding with the pillaging of the natural world. Its s o wrong.
column9: Hi Anne, 97% of the palm oil used in our products is from certified sustainable palm oil sources and we're working hard to convert the remainder. We were the first major UK retailer to launch an own-brand washing up liquid made from fully certified sustainable palm oil. You can read more about this here under 'Raw Materials': http://bit.ly/1J2UshS. Have a great day! Ryan.

column4: I know Sainsbury s does state where its produce comes from  but would it be possible to categorise products from the UK? (particularly online) I am conscious both of the environmental impact and the need to support local producers.
column9: Hi Billy, thanks for getting in touch! A lot of our products are named 'British' when they're exclusively from the UK (such as chicken breasts, jubilee vine tomatoes and more - these have ""British"" in the product name on our website) however I totally understand what you mean. Are there any such products that don't easily display the information online that you know of? I'll log the feedback with the relevant team to be reviewed. Ryan.

column4: I want to say a big thank you to a member of staff in your Perton Wolverhampton store for her kindness yesterday morning around 9am. I think her name was Pauline. I was at the self-service till and my baby started to cry in his pram. She came over and chatted to him  jingled her keys at him and managed to stop him from crying as I scanned my items through and she helped other customers on the self-service tills at the same time. It made my shopping trip far less stressful. Thanks again!
column9: It's the little things that make a difference Hannah! I'm really pleased that my colleague could help out, shopping with a little one can be tricky! column4: Very disappointed. Ordered an online delivery for yesterday including baby food needed for my young baby  waiting in all morning after booking and paying for an 830am delivery slot. Called again an hour later and was told they couldn t come anymore and the would reschedule for the next morning after 3 hours of waiting in following a slot I had paid for. Apparently there had been a hold up their end with processing the payment. Waited in again this morning and the driver has just arrived with the food that had apparently been picked yesterday and driven round all day in the van  had been stored somewhere overnight and the majority of which was due to go out of date today - on the day of delivery! What a joke.

Called again an hour later and was told they couldn t come anymore and the would reschedule for the next morning after 3 hours of waiting in following a slot I had paid for. Apparently there had been a hold up their end with processing the payment. Waited in again this morning and the driver has just arrived with the food that had apparently been picked yesterday and driven round all day in the van  had been stored somewhere overnight and the majority of which was due to go out of date today - on the day of delivery! What a joke.

column4: My wife and I always use Sainsburys for our weekly food shop. However today was disgraceful on Sainburys behalf. My wife and I went food shopping and when I went to pay with my debit card it declined twice so instead of trying a third time and blocking my card we resorted to using her card  which went through. Then when we got I went straight on my bank to check why it would have declined. Too find that both declined amounts had been deducted from my available balance. I then went back to the store to ask them to sort it out  to have them tell me they cannot do anything as they are having technical issue and that I will have to wait until the funds get returned to my bank in around 5 days or so... Which is ridiculous ! No offer of any compensation/vouchers for their mistake.
column9: Plymouth

column4: My husband and I have shopped at Sainsbury s for many years not only do we food shop here we get our petrol and I buy most of my clothes here. We love  everything about your stores and of course we find collecting our nectar points a great added bonus and really help with our budget so you can imagine our disappointment when the other evening we had a £10 off voucher for a internet shop and at the checkout we discovered that there was no code number on the voucher so we were unable to process our voucher so lost our saving  and on top of this in the past couple of weeks you go through tills in store only to find no paper hence no voucher. We will not shop else where but just wish these problems did not happen and can understand when customer not only enjoy saving our nectar points they are also can be a necessary help in managing our budget

column4: I was in the cafe in Sainsburys Neston on Sunday. I ended up talking to a lady who is 96  her son and a manager about their places in the war and mentioned my Grandma is 99 next month. The manager dissapeared and came back with two beautiful bunches of flowers for my Grandma and two for the lady I was chatting with. There are still lovely people in the world and i shall be thanking him in person too x

column4: Sainsbury s   Last month I posted a comment about how amazing your staff are at my local store here in Leeds are. I have just moved into the area and i do suffer with a few mental health problems so i am unable to leave the house some days. But after speaking to staff at my local store it was agreed i could come with my dog  wait outside  and your staff would do my shopping for me. I do not do weekly or monthly shops. I go everyday  around 7am when you open and buy 2-3 items. One of your staff  Jill  is outstanding  she actually comes outside the store to hold Bella so i can go in. After my comment last month you contacted the store and Jill has now been given a reward for showing  outstanding customer service  for going above & beyond to help a customer who has mental health problems.  But this morning things went bad. I got to the store as normal  Jill came out  took Bella and i went in  i got a bottle of Pepsi Max  some banana s and a pizza  then went to the kiosk to pay (no normal manned tills was open). There was a young girl with pink or red highlights leaning on a normal till doing nothing. But that was it.  I then waited at the kiosk for 6-7 mins while a person in front of me was doing a batch of lotto tickets  and this 6-7 mins the young girl with pink or red highlights was still doing nothing. Didn t even open a till for me like Andy  Cathy  Mike always do.She stood there doing nothing.  Then said girl walked over to the Kiosk  picked up the phone and phoned store management. On the phone she said  I feel like i should let you know. Jill is stood outside holding a dog doing no work at all.  As which point i walked over to her  i said  No  its my dog  Jill always does this for me  heck she has even been rewarded for it  to which i was blanked  and after the call she young girl just walked away.  This has left me feeling very angry. Why would she phone the store manager to snitch about a member of staff when she could of just asked Jill what she was doing? Why did she not open a normal till? Why did she totally blank me and walk off?  I used to work as a CTS at Sainsbury s  before being promoted to a night manager & i would NEVER expect one of my staff to of done that. it s important to trust the people you work with. How can Jill trust her when she is running to the manager instead of just asking Jill what she was doing?  I really do hope Jill does not get into trouble  and she gets to keep her reward. The store was Leeds Headingley.
column9: I'm really sorry Lee. I completely understand how disappointing and frustrating this must've been. I've passed the details of your experience along to the store management team, who'll be able to look into this and deal with it at the store level. We really appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Danny.

column9: Hi Anne-marie, hope you're well. Our buying team have advised us that there has been no change in relation to the breed, feed or growing conditions for any of our whole birds that we sell in-store however they did advise that as it is a natural product there may be some variation between samples. While this could be part of the reason, any variation in cooking conditions can also affect the succulence of the product, in turn this can affect the flavour. I hope this helps. If you have any further questions, please feel free to ask! Ryan.

column9: I'm surprised you, as an ethical vegan, are even considering shopping in Sainsburys as they profit from the sale of animal products.  By shopping with them you're helping support the trade in animal products, or are you still in the transitioning phase of becoming a fully fledged vegan?  You should shop in 100% vegan establishments.  Also, Facebook is run by a high percentage of people who eat meat and use animal-based products.  By using Facebook you are helping to support their ability to buy and consume animal products.  Best stay off FB to stay true to the vegan life choice.

column4: Like a lot of people I have an app on my phone where I store all my loyalty cards. Other supermarkets are happy to do this for their cards.
column9: Ok, your decision 😒 just find it strange. So much technology around, paperless/plastic less society,we are encouraged to embrace it, (save the planet) but we now have to make sure we carry a plastic card around with us.

column4: Was at Sainsburys  Monkscross  York earlier the evening with My Granddaughter Lydia. Lydia wanted a bag of  pick & mix   but when she opened the lid of a jelly sweet box she noticed many of the sweets had been half eaten  and she said she could see saliva on some of them. The same thing in some of the other boxes. I showed this to an assistant who went and got a manager. He came along with 2 other assistants. I pointed out that this was a health risk as the sweets would now be contaminated. I suggested that the boxes affected should be removed. After waffling on about doenuts (not sure why)  she told one of the men with him to get some gloves. Lydia and I walked off  but Lydia sneeked back to see what they would do. The man wearing gloves removed the half eaten sweets  but chucked back the whole ones!!!!  I supose nothing more was done  unsuspecting customers will let their children buy these saliva contaminated sweets (who knows what diseases the  eater  may have had.) Would that Manager allow his own children to eat those sweets knowing they could be covered with other peoples spit?
column9: That's absolutely rank 😷😷
