column4: Just been to Sainsbury s at Alphington to get petrol. One selfish motorist taking up two petrol places so I go to one that says it has a long hose  undo petrol cap and put the hose into the tank and pull the trigger. It clicks and clicks again  as if it is full but I know it is only a quarter full  so I take finger off trigger and take it out of tank. Petrol gushes out of the hose  hitting the car and back out all over my face  clothes  new suede bag  shoes and floor! I quickly put it back into tank  wait  pull trigger again and just click click. I leave hose in tank opening and walk into shop and asks that someone come out and help. So  this young attendant does and she takes over the hose but is not much more successful. She then says I am too far away from the petrol pump! I am one foot away - I point this out. She then says it is because my car is too long (!) - then  she says was my tank empty - no I say a quarter full...that s the trouble she says  when it is a quarter full! I tell her I always come to Sainsbury s at the same time every Saturday with a quarter full tank and put £20 worth of petrol in and this has not happened before  so I don t buy that excuse either.. She then tells me that she has gone over the £20....click click clicking away. We go into the petrol shop and (a) she does not apologise on behalf of Sainsbury s; (b) does not offer anything to wipe my face  bag  shoes  trousers and top with - I am dripping in petrol. I then get charged for the petrol that has gone all over me and the floor!! I tell her I have now got to go and meet my daughter in the Vintage Centre for a look round and then go shopping...absolutely no word of apology!! I ask if it was because of an air lock in the petrol pump and she says  brazen as anything   probably !! Sainsbury s - my next message is going to you!  Shoppers in the Vintage Centre all keeping their  distance from smelly old me  so after a quick look round  I go home to have a shower. A potentially lovely afternoon spoilt!
column9: Oh goodness, I'm very sorry about this Rose. Could you PM us the name of the colleague that assisted you? Maria

column4: Where can I find a list of Sainsbury s own brand makeup that is suitable for Vegans please?

column4: For a few weeks now  in my online shopping  I ve ordered the two new flavours of Vimto. And every time I ve gone to put the items in my  trolley  I ve had no problem  there s no message to say it s unavailable/out of stock. But when my shopping is delivered its always substituted! Could you update the webpage to say it s out of stock to avoid the substitutes being returned! My shopping  I believe  comes from the Tunbridge Wells store. While I m talking about substitutes  can you not find a substitute for Echo Falls fruit fusion wine? Order pickers should be able to see our order histories in order to be able to pick a decent substitute maybe?!
column9: They don't mark things as out of stock because they don't know what will be on the shelf when your order is picked.

column4: For a few weeks now  in my online shopping  I ve ordered the two new flavours of Vimto. And every time I ve gone to put the items in my  trolley  I ve had no problem  there s no message to say it s unavailable/out of stock. But when my shopping is delivered its always substituted! Could you update the webpage to say it s out of stock to avoid the substitutes being returned! My shopping  I believe  comes from the Tunbridge Wells store. While I m talking about substitutes  can you not find a substitute for Echo Falls fruit fusion wine? Order pickers should be able to see our order histories in order to be able to pick a decent substitute maybe?!
column9: Hi Elaine! We don't update our website with stock availability, I'm afraid. When you place your order, the pickers will collect the items you've ordered to be added to your delivery on the day it's going out. This means that, although we will stock certain items, and those items will appear on our website, there's a chance they will be unavailable by the time the pickers are collecting your order. The subs are at the discretion of the pickers, as I'm sure you can appreciate they have a very busy job trying to collect all of the items, and might not have the time to look through individual order histories. Sorry for the inconvenience. Daryl.

column4: I would just like to say a massive thank you to Tracy who works at the crystal peaks Sheffield store for going out of her way to help me. Being a very forgetful last minute mum I popped in on the off chance the store had a batman fancy dress outfit for my son  it was 15 minutes before the store closed and I was frantically searching through the rails looking for my sons size. Tracy saw my distress and came over to ask if I needed any help I replied saying that I needed help with organisation and to not be so forgetful to which we both laughed I said I was desperate to get my son a batman outfit as he was going to cosplay tomorrow. Tracy offered to go and look in the back for the right size  she came out a few minutes later with a beaming smile on her face and the batman outfit. I was so happy and thanked her and almost skipped to the checkout. I told the check out lady how wonderful and helpful Tracy was and she told me that it was her birthday tomorrow. So Tracy thankyou so much for your help and I hope you have a wonderful birthday 😊🎂
column9: Thanks very much Sarah! I've made sure your lovely comments have been fed back to the store. Amanda.

column4: Dear Sainsburys   I m really disappointed that you ve unleashed your DWF lawyers on my employee for using a fuel card your staff told her she could use.    In short  my employee wondering into your Swansea station and asked if they accepted her fuel card.  Your employee said yes  we do but as it turned out  you didn t.   Now  having tried to pay the balance  we ve got a bill which is double the value of the fuel following a mistake your employee made.  Not cool Sainsburys!  What are you going to do about it?  Jason
column9: Hi Jason, I completely understand your concerns with this. Can you confirm when this happened please? We'd like to raise this with the store management team. Danny.

column4: When are you going to take John West Tuna of off your shelves ????????????????????????????????????????????????
column9: No supermarket is taking it off their shelves.

column4: Incredible! My partner got a text from you on Sunday about a change of account details  if it wasn t her to contact you. It wasn t her so she contacted you  taken around the houses trying to get it sorted as your call centre staff are beyond incompetent  told different things multiple times:  - The account was closed  there is no risk of an order being put through  - The account is active  but no card details stored  - The account has had an order put through  but the store that was going to deliver caught and stopped the order due to fraud and a refund was being processed  - Sainsburys are unable to handle fraud as there aren t enough resources within your business to handle it (These are the words used by one of your staff)  - The fraud department would give her a call (Which was never received)  - The order was processed and goods delivered  no refund has been issued  We are now in a situation where we are £500 down  with little to no support from Sainsburys  contradicting and outright shameful support from your staff.   Right now I am going to call the Police (Action Fraud)  under data protection I will be requesting a copy of all the calls we made  as well as the Information Commissioner regarding your handling of our data.  We are currently awaiting a call from you  but I don t hold out much hope. Now Santander have cancelled the card to prevent any further transactions which leave us without a bank card meaning we are unable to shop or withdraw cash.   Thank you Sainsburys  you have been nothing short of spectacular in your level of poor customer service.
column9: I'm really sorry about this Tom, your best bet would be to discuss this with your bank. We will of course cooperate with any police investigation. Steven

column9: I am not getting into this again! The order was made by the hacker/fraud account, so we don't have an order number. The email address was changed to that of the hacker/fraudsters, so again we don't have that.   Its beggars belief you can't find the account from the mobile number I have given you, after all you sent text messages to it to say the account had been updated and if it wasn't done by us to contact you.   The level of incompetence has become too much. I will be documenting this misery on a website, and will then be looking to make sure that other consumers are aware of your handling of your online customers, especially those who have been a victim of a crime and when looking to you for support get fobbed off.   Please provide me with the contact details for your Data Protection Officer, I will handle this with them and the Police (Action Fraud), depending on the outcome of my information request I will then pass this over the the ICO to investigate.

column4: Hi Sainsburys I visited your shop in Wadsley Bridge  Sheffield today to purchase the Just Love Food Company pink castle birthday cake. It s my friends daughters party tomorrow and as my own daughter has allergies my friend always makes a special trip to Sainsburys to buy a safe cake so that my daughter is included in the celebrations.  There were no pink castle cakes on the shelf and no label either. We spoke to a staff member who told us that it s not being stocked anymore because the summer range has been brought in so the castle cake has been replaced by a pink rose (which is not nut allergy friendly I hasten to add). There are now no nut safe pink girly cakes in store and we are hugely disappointed :-( Is this a permanent move?
column9: Hi Liisa, that's ashame. I'm sorry about that, can you let us know if this is the product http://bit.ly/1VzT5ZH? Maryclare

column4: I ve just been into the Grove Farm Triangle and initially I was really pleased to see the extended Free From range  but left disappointed.  In all of the new products (around 20)  not one cake/flapjack/brownie item was egg free.  Considering the amount of people who don t eat eggs (vegans  those who are allergic and those who choose not to eat them)  and the number of egg free cake shops springing up there is a market for egg free  Is there an intention to extend the range to include egg free products too?  Thanks Amanda

column4: Went in to my local sainsbury s after hearing that the free from range had  had a revamp. However after looking through the products I m really disappointed. I ve got coeliac disease  and unfortunately like majority of people with Coeliac  cannot tolerate oats even if they are gluten free. The whole range of free from biscuits all have gluten free oat flour in them  apart from other brands such as Schar! And it s not just that  it s not very clear on the front of the packaging that they contain it or that the recipe has changed! Why has it changed? Is there a reason? Most people shopping in the free from section would presume that they all would be suitable at a glance just as they used to be. It s a shame as Ive always preferred to shop at sainsbury s for the quality of the products in free from especially your biscuits  but you ve followed suit with tesco. It looks like I ll have to find an alternative supermarket to get my bits for the family shop!
column9: Sorry about this Nicole, I'll get your comments fed back. Which store did you visit? Susanna

I suffer of endometriosis and fibroids hence I need to eat oranic produces. Since I started eating organic I have seen all the gradual improvements in my health. Eating organic  for some of us is a necessity  not a way to  feel posh . I hope you ll hear my voice ^_^ Yours affectionate   Anna
column9: Hey Anna, thanks for getting in touch! Which of our stores is closest to you? I can log your interest in the organic asparagus for our buyers. Let me know! Kirsty

column4: Hi Sainsbury s  please can you clarify the source of the L-cysteine used in your own brand bread products (particularly tortilla wraps). The tortilla wraps seen recently in store are labelled as vegetarian/vegan while still containing l-cysteine  which as far as I am able to discover is usually sourced from avian feathers and/or human hair  and not what many would consider vegan (definitely not) or even vegetarian. Thanks!
column9: Thank you

column4: Yesterday I visited the store in Grimsby and spent over £40 and at the till tried to use a £6 off voucher only to be told that it couldn t be used on baby items. We then found out that you don t get nectar points either. Why is this?  Can you explain why? It seems that if you have a child your penalised but Sainsburys.
column9: Supermarkets are not allowed to do promotions on baby food, milk etc, it's against the law.

column4: Bought a 50 inch LG tv last year from you and for no reason it has just fell completely of stand that came with it after being located in same location since purchase and collapsed during the night when I was sleeping.Bolts are still in tv so no doubt that stand supplied has eventually gave in to tv weight and not been fit for purpose. Glad I or my child was not near it at the time. ??????????????
column9: Incorrect, Susanna; if the stand that Sainsbury's supplied with the TV was not fit for purpose (which, based on Laura's account it wasn't) then Sainsburys' legal responsibility extends far beyond 12 months and has nothing to do with any warranty.

column9: Oh no, sorry about this Laura. I definitely understand your disappointment over this. Was the TV bought less than 12 months ago? If so, it'll still be covered by the warranty and can be taken into store with your receipt for a refund. Susanna

column4: Popped into Sainsbury s this afternoon. A message came over the tannoy.  This is a colleague announcement. Would all staff note that the afternoon rumble is about to start.  Trouble was  I thought it said  The afternoon grumble is about to start . Suddenly I had visions of staff coming together to have a good old moan about their working conditions  about rude customers  and about the price of bread. So I asked the nice lady on the cooked meat counter  who thought the idea of a collective grumble was great  and she d pop it into the suggestion box as a customer request. Apparently a  rumble  is Sainsbury-speak for   Let s tidy the shelves.  Except it s probably not a suggestion... She also told me that a young lad on work experience thought it was a literal order  using street argot  and that he would have to go off and fight the permanent staff. Suddenly  shopping at Sainsbury s became a lot more interesting....
column9: I always pictured the asda staff beating each other with stale bakery goods when I heard them being called for the rumble.

column4: I m new to online grocery shopping having recently had my second baby. I have to say I love the convenience of having the food delivered but I am really disappointed with the short shelf life of fresh items. One of the main advantages of online shopping would be to only have to do a weekly shop....with what has arrived today I will find myself back in the supermarket by Sunday
column9: Hi Claire. Sorry you're unhappy with your delivery. Could you DM us with your order number and some more info on which products were out of date? Thanks. Daryl.

column4: I feel your store really need to look at your policy on parent and child spaces! (In fact most car parks) Just had a woman get the last parent/child space in front of me at your Kirkcaldy store and get out with 3 children approx ages 6  9 and 13  kids get out no problem and all walk merrily into the store. Meanwhile I then have to park in a normal space  squeeze round to get the chassis out the boot and get my 5 month baby s car seat out (thankfully I d parked with a space on that side) However on returning to my car  there s a car beside us now. Again I squeeze round and start unloading my shopping. Fold down the chassis  get it into the boot carefully and then have to squeeze my baby boy  in his car seat  in through a small gap to get him in the car. Said woman and children come strolling back to their car  get in and drive off as I m still negotiating how to get a baby in a car seat in through this space without bashing both cars! Fair enough she has children and is allowed to park there as their policy is  1 or more children under the age of 12  but maybe your car parks should have baby spaces as well as child spaces. Not impressed today 😡
column9: Sorry you're unhappy Julie. Parent child bays are provided as a courtesy on a first come first served basis. They can indeed be used by parents with children up to the age of 12 as well as parents with babies. We feel this is the fairest way to cater for the needs of all customers with children. Liz

Fair enough she has children and is allowed to park there as their policy is  1 or more children under the age of 12  but maybe your car parks should have baby spaces as well as child spaces. Not impressed today 😡

column4: Hi - who can I write to about Sainsbury s car parks? The one in Nantwich has heavy-duty metal black bollards all over it. Yesterday  I was SLOWLY pulling out of my parking space  when another car came racing up from my left. I had to turn the wheel sharply to the right to avoid it...and VERY SLOWLY (my foot was still on the clutch) dinked the bollard. The bollard is designed to cause maximum car damage - it dented not only the door but (more expensively) the sill underneath as well. I have received quotations of around £700 + VAT to mend my car. I understand that these bollards are to stop people parking on pedestrian walkways  but can they not be made of heavy-duty rubber or some similarly  soft  material? Failing that  can they not be re-designed NOT to crunch up car sills? I ve been shopping at this store for years - but now I m going to Morrissons instead where they manage to survive without bollards.
column9: Hi Merryn, sorry your car has been damaged. Can you PM your full contact details? I'd like to get this passed to our executive team to be looked into. Susanna

column4: I have just left your Castle Marina Nottingham store in  a very angry and confused state. I drove to this store to by part of my monthly shopping  this is something I have done for a number of years. Silly me did not have a pound coin in my pocket for the trolly. No problem I thought I will go into the shop to exchange a five-pound note for pound coins. To my shock   and amazement I was told by the member of staff they could not do this. I explained that I wanted to do my shopping and I did have my shopping bags in my hand  still I was informed that this exchange could not take place. So your company is losing a custom  who for years felt he was a valued customer. I will now go to another retailer who I am sure would not turn me away and value my custom.

column4: I have to say I m totally disgusted in the service at Alphington store (Exeter). I simply phoned up around 11.30  asking for 2 trays of stuffing to be cooked and put back so I can pick up in around 45 minutes as I often do as a weekly ritual (you can t beat Sainsbury s hot counter stuffing!)   Originally talking to a lovely woman who I asked to be put through to the hot counter then I get this woman shouting down the end of the phone  with he must  un  courteous voice  saying we don t do that  I explained I always do it and I never have had an issue at a Sainsbury s store including this store. She passed me over to be what I believe a team leader named Ian  who was then rude and straight to the point of we can t  asked why?! It s against policy  and no other store should do it  then after a 10 minute discussion the ovens are full....  - phone pinhoe road Sainsbury s  come back in an hour and pick up your stuffing!!  So since when do they not look in the customers interest? I am totally discusted in Sainsbury s and the attitude of there staff in Alphington road!!!
column9: Hi Sam. I'm really sorry you've had this experience. I've been in contact with the Alphington store and fed this back to them. Our staff try and be as helpful and friendly as possible; as such we're hoping this was an isolated incident. I'm glad you got your stuffing in the end! Daryl.

column4: I went to one of your stores in Oxford at the weekend to buy my 2 month old son some teething gel as he was showing signs of teething.  I went to scan the product and noticed it was out of date. So  I went back to get another one and there ended up being three out of date tubes... THREE.  Considering this is a product that goes into a child s mouth  they d ensure it was all IN DATE before selling...? I took all the out of date tubes to the costumer service desk to inform them and give them the tubes to throw away/send back or whatever they do with them. I got a snotty response  which made me mad. I demanded to see the manager as I was angry that I could have put that in my baby s mouth... I was told they were busy.  I am not happy about this  and I thought I d post this to make sure everyone checks the products before they buy.  I still cannot believe they were trying so sell something that was out of date. Absolute disgrace.  I m almost sure this post will be deleted  so share before they do and let everyone know!

column4: What on earth has happened to the gorgeous scones I used to purchase from your bakery? The taste has totally changed and a pack I bought just the other day was cold...so cold the checkout operator commented on it !!!
column9: Hi Helen, our technologist has come back to us with.   Yes we have recently improved the recipe of our ISB scones making them larger, increasing the amount of fruit in the Cherry and Sultana scones and making the in store processing easier to ensure consistency. The old product came in as a frozen scone puck that was baked off in store and the new product comes in full finished. We previously had issues with the quality of the baked off product where stores would defrost the puck resulting in very poor product. We customer panel all products before making any changes and all three new variants were preferred over the old product.  I hope this information is helpful to you. Steven

column4: Can you please explain to me why I was refused service for buying paracetamol at your Wigan store just now for not having ID  given there are no age restrictions for over the counter medication in the UK?
column9: Sorry about that Anthony. Our policy states that sales are restricted to a maximum of 2 packets of a combination of any paracetamol, aspirin or ibuprofen based products per transaction. Sales are also restricted to customers aged 16 and over. In line with most other supermarkets, we have taken these steps as a responsible retailer to ensure these products are purchased and used appropriately. A wider range of analgesics in larger pack sizes are available from our pharmacies, sold under the supervision of a pharmacist. Thanks, Naomi.

column4: Can you please explain to me why I was refused service for buying paracetamol at your Wigan store just now for not having ID  given there are no age restrictions for over the counter medication in the UK?
column9: Sorry Anthony, our colleagues follow our Think 25 policy for all age restricted products, so if you look under 25 you will be asked for ID. Leigh

column4: Can you please explain to me why I was refused service for buying paracetamol at your Wigan store just now for not having ID  given there are no age restrictions for over the counter medication in the UK?

column4: Much has appeared in the media about the problems experienced by many sectors of the population because of either background music or blaring ads instore. Your Kelso store is still broadcasting exceptionally loud  pointless ads which begin  Welcome to Sainsbury s . What  precisely  is the point of advertising the shop at people who are already shopping in it? The sudden noise is appalling because of the exceptional volume of these insultingly inane announcements. The sentence is incomplete because it should actually be preceded by the word  You re   thus making it  You re welcome to Sainsbury s . Why are you turning this shop into such an unpleasant shopping environment with the intermittent mindless store ads and the disappearance of so many cooking-from-scratch items? What have we done to upset you?
column9: Sorry you're not a fan Sandie, when did you last visit our Kelso store? I'll get your feedback logged with the relevant team for internal review. Steven

column4: Sainsbury . I was quick to publicly thank you for providing not one but three nut free cakes (also gluten free ) in your new free from range . Sadly I was too quick .  On visiting today I left empty handed as the cakes are tiny ! No good for a children s party of 10-12 kids and on comparison to other nutty cakes not only much smaller but of course not such good value either .  Why because my child has the misfortune to have a life threatening food allergy should she have to miss out on purchasing a shop brought cake for her birthday ? Please consider larger versions of the same cakes   if nothing else the chocolate one looked frankly ridiculous sitting in a box way too large for the cake !!
column9: Hi Angela. Sorry about that. I'd certainly be happy to log this feedback for you. Can you PM me with the 1st line of your address and postcode? Thanks. Daryl.

Why because my child has the misfortune to have a life threatening food allergy should she have to miss out on purchasing a shop brought cake for her birthday ? Please consider larger versions of the same cakes   if nothing else the chocolate one looked frankly ridiculous sitting in a box way too large for the cake !!
column9: You should consider yourself lucky they stock any at all!

column4: Hi Sainsburys  I have placed my first and last shop with yourselves! Iv had a basket open for several days that I kept adding too as and when  last night I logged in and my basket had dissapeared! After looking atound for a while I downloaded your app  amazingly my basket appeared in the app  then the sage of trying to pay began  I was imputing my card details  getting the message saying the card was  added  and then it would cycle me back to the pahe saying to add my card details. Eventually I gave up with the app. I logged on to the sitr one last time where to my suprise my basket had appeared again  and even better it then accepted my card details.  I only persivered as i had already invested time selecting all the shopping to put in my basket. What was ment to be a time saving exercise turned into a big liad of faff  I will be returning to my usual shops now! Very disappointed Sainsburys!

column4: I received a voucher code last week from my shopping in store for £10 off of a £50 online shop for delivery or click and collect. Put the required amount of goods in my trolley and when I went to checkout realised the voucher is actually missing the code to input for the offer  Ended up walking a couple of miles to my local store to get a few essentials and enquire about this to be told to call a number to get it sorted which they did give me  so several hours after trying to buy online with this code I get told it will be by 8pm tomorrow that you will be able to email me a new code to use to get this offer  this is completely useless for me as this was shopping for a festival and I needed it delivered Tues Night or collect by 8am Wednesday (staff in store told me they are open from 7am and wouldn t be a problem) Now When i go online to check times for click and collect the earliest you do is 8.30am which is after my train leaves. As such now I will be unable to use this voucher as noone seems to be able to find a way around it and will have to hope that I can buy what I need before 8am on wednesday with no discounts (is alcohol available to sell before 8am?) I would really appreciate if someone could help sort this out for me

column4: Just been to your Monks Cross store  usually I m annoyed by the unnecessarily OTT happiness of shop assistants  but I was served by a gentleman called Collin. 1stly Collin helped a man who was shopping alone with a small boy of maybe 2 by letting the child sit and draw on an excess bit of till roll while his (assumed) dad paid and packed the shopping.  This made me smile. 2ndly when serving me and my partner  Collin just had a way about him that really made me leave feeling happy and well served  I can t even explain what this man did  I just know that everyone who is served by Collin will leave feeling good and with a smile. I just wanted to let you know all this and see if their was a way you could let Collin know that he made a usually grumpy  and unsociable person like myself smile for no other reason than I was served by him.
column9: This is lovely feedback James, I'm really pleased my colleague Colin could help! Could you PM us a pic of the codes at the bottom of your receipt? This will help us pass the comments to the store manager. Thanks, Kirsty

column4: Just been into your store in Kidderminster. Picked up a mug off a hook which caught the mug on the hook above  sending it flying as it was so full. Retrieved the pieces off the floor and took to customer services  offering to pay for the breakage - cut myself in the process. Asked for a plaster but staff member couldn t find one so carried on with my shopping as it only looked a small nick. Looked down two minutes later to see blood everywhere - went to the pharmacy to ask for a plaster but told there was no first aid box  eventually handed a  piece of paper towel. Is it not standard procedure to have a first aid box for staff and customers in each department? It certainly was when I worked for one of your rival supermarkets a fair few years ago! Not to mention unhygienic to let a customer wander around with a laceration. Needless to say I left promptly but surprised at the apathetic attitude of your staff.
column9: Oh no, really sorry Georgie! Is your hand ok? Can you PM us the names of the colleagues you spoke with? I want to make sure your feedback is fully logged for all relevant departments. Thanks, Kirsty

column4: Do you really think it s acceptable to send a loaf of bread with a 2 day sell by date on it? Thank  you sainsburys I ordered my groceries online because we both work full time and have two children. We received  a phone call this morning saying you were having a few problems at your warehouse and our delivery would be 2 hours late. Inconvenient but I can cope with that. What I can t deal with is when my shopping arrives with no fruit/ veg  no household  no pet food  as well as a number of other items and a very stressed out driver who has no paperwork and can t even take back unwanted substitutes. Yep even the few items we did receive had 4 that were not what I ordered!! This is not convenient I don t order my shopping online to have to go food shopping anyway as you can t even manage to fulfil basic items on an order. I m not talking the blood of a Virgin or dragons eggs here more like potatoes and apples!!

column4: In sainsburys tollgate. Surprised to see half frozen fresh rolls on shelves!!! Not a good practice. Guess they are trying to reduce waste
column9: Hi Tony, I've given the Stanway bakery a quick call to get the low-down on this for you. We have a range of items which come into store prebaked, and a large selection which are baked fresh in the store. Our prebaked brioche buns come frozen to preserve their freshness, and will usually be fully defrosted and put out for sale, which in this case they weren't quite ready! My colleague in the bakery checked the packaging and advised that they state 'previously frozen' however if you choose to freeze them this would be at your own discretion. If you've any questions regarding this next time you're in store, feel free to ask one of our bakery colleagues for some help and they'll be happy to oblige. Ryan.

column4: I m gutted  Due to an on-line computer error  My shopping was delivered late.. No problem with this as I was still home to receive it  and I opened the door with a huge smile of relief at receiving todays lunch and dinner. My problem is of all the things delivered was merely the  junk  No milk  meat  sandwich fillers  cheese  frozen stuff or vegetables. I m to feed 7 people tonight on junk or bread and water. I ve no bill to indicate how much I ve been charged. I ve had wrong stuff delivered which are not cost effective (small pack wipes and wrong flavoured food)   and well yes I could live with all this ordinarily as it really doesn t make life hard just more expensive.. EXCEPT I am on a training course tonight  and now have no time to get out and get any food to feed the 7 of us between now and later. It s going to cost me a whole lot more money to get a takeaway in  and then I ve got to reorder almost my entire shopping list!  So whilst the initial offer of a voucher was nice It s actually going to cost me more than that in another delivery cost as well as the food I now have to buy tonight AND the school dinner I have to pay for tomorrow!
column9: Hi Bel, as they items are scanned in store, which is how your bill is ultimately calculated, if you haven't received the items, you shouldn't have been charged for them. Nevertheless, I'm really sorry for the inconvenience caused. Can you please PM your order number, the name, contact number and address on your account? Danny.

column4: sainsbury.... well done on your customer service  I am an aged live in carer and decided to open a online account to enable shopping to be done with-out having to leave the house. so after registering an account i received an email from you offering me a £15.00 e-voucher  I read the terms and conditions and did exactly as i was instructed and went ahead and placed my order and checked out to my dismay the voucher stated it had expired which in fact it only does on the 26.6.2016  i though TYPICAL just another advertising ploy to get us shopping  so i completed my shopping and logged out but feeling annoyed I decided to call the help centre (i ususally never complain about things) but this really annoyed me. what a fantastic call took seconds to answer so very very polite and with a few seconds he logged into my account and deducted £20.00 off my shopping and bid me a wonderful day. So Sainsbury keep up your excellent customer service and top class training of your staff. this was well worth my time and now i am one very happy customer.. thank you thank you thankyou

column4: Just been to one of the multiple Sainsburys in Bath (Odd Down location) to be told I cannot redeem Nectar points there as I haven t been 3 times. Despite having frequented Sainsburys many times in every other location. Not impressed and absolutely ridiculous for a loyalty scheme. Sorry - lost a customer here. Waitrose from now on!
column9: I'm really sorry about that Gabi. When did you visit the store? Providing this was when the Nectar helpline were open, you should have been offered the opportunity to carry out a Nectar workaround. Your Nectar card will be registered to one particular 'home' store, this is to prevent fraud. If you visit another store, a colleague should have you phone Nectar, to answer some security questions, you should then be able to spend your points immediately. Thanks, Naomi.

column4: Seems to be a lot of misunderstanding about June 23rd  and people want to know the facts. Here are some:  You are not voting to leave the EEA or WTO  meaning all of the UK s trade and benefit agreements will remain unchanged should we leave  until such a time that the UK decides to renegotiate them for any reason.  You are not voting to leave NATO  meaning our security agreements remain unchanged. Should we receive an act of hostility from a non-NATO member  then NATO countries are obliged to come to our assistance. This does not change.  You are not voting to leave the UN  G8 or G20  meaning Britain will have the same voice on the world stage as it does today.  You are not voting to leave Europe!! The UK will still  geographically  be part of Europe. Non political organisations aligned to Europe will still extend membership to the UK (I.e. sports governing bodies  and so on).  You are not voting to stop recognising Interpol  Europol and neither are you voting for SIS / MI6 to stop dealing with other intelligence services in the fight against terrorism and global  organised crime.  You are not voting against being able to travel to Europe  contrary to the belief of some fools recently on TV. The UK has always maintained stricter border and passport controls than many EU members. This will not change. You will still use a passport to go on holiday and you will still be allowed entry to countries in Europe. You may even get chance to skip queues by using the non--EU queues at the airport (the only point so far that is my opinion  and not necessarily a fact).  The UK economy will benefit to the tune of £billions in the first year after we leave.  Medical and science research will not simply stop. The UK pays into the EU to then get money back in the form of funding. The UK will now be in control of this money and can choose to fund whatever UK based medical  science  art or other research it chooses.  Farming will not lose money because of EU funding being cut. The UK negotiated a rebate of some monies that the UK pays to the EU  in order to subsidise UK farmers. Instead of asking for our money back  we can give it straight to farmers. No change there.  You are not voting against human rights. The EU Convention on  and European Court of Human Rights are not part of the EU. Until parliament passes a new bill of rights for the UK  these will still apply  as will precedents already passed down to UK courts from Brussels.  You are not voting to kick anyone out of the UK or block access to anyone. Neither are you voting to stop recruiting valuable European workers into things like the NHS. Like my other point about passports for travel  the UK is already outside of the Schengen zone and so migrant workers must enter the UK with a valid passport before and after June 23rd. That will not change. British borders maintain full control of who comes and goes. Should someone have the skills to apply to work in the NHS  then they will still be permitted travel and given an opportunity to apply for a job. Worst case  points based assessment  like the US  Canada and Australia use  will come into effect. The UK is likely to negotiate freedom of labour movement though  in exchange for freedom of goods movement.  You are not voting to move jobs nor production out of the UK! The EU actually helped fund the move of Ford Transit production from the UK to Turkey... Yes  the EU helped give UK jobs to people in Turkey by giving Ford a loan of £80m with very generous terms!  What you are voting for is UK sovereignty. You are voting to stay in or leave a political union of leaders and representatives that you British people did not elect. You are voting against a commission of unelected  elite men that nobody at all voted for and yet they make decisions on our behalf. You are simply voting to bring sovereignty back to Westminster  and that is all. If you worry about that because you don t like the Conservative government  look at the reality. Their majority in parliament is very slim. They have been blocked on big decisions already. You are therefore not giving sovereignty to David Cameron  but to the UK House of elected representatives. Do not be fooled by the fear campaigns that are simply run by the wealthy  who need EU money to thrive! Think about the future  and your family s future.
column9: Looking forward to Sainbury's customer service response.

column4: Absolutely disgusting that Sainsbury local store charges double to the price than they do in the bigger stores. I certainly won t be using them again.
column9: Hi there Jane. Sorry for the upset. Different sizes of stores have very different operational requirements and running costs, which in turn affect our product pricing.  Our local stores tend to have higher operating costs than our superstores as they’re located in more expensive locations and have longer opening hours.  In addition, factors involving staffing, local rates and focus on convenience products also contribute to the difference in product pricing. Please be reassured that despite the above, we always strive to ensure we are offering great value for money across our local stores.  We do this by monitoring our local prices weekly against our supermarkets and other competitors. Maria

column4: I am absolutely disgusted by the conversation I just had with Sainsbury s. My order which was due to arrive between 10-11am cannot be delivered today. I am offered a refund but have now got to replace a huge order as I have visitors arriving today with no time to do so.  I thought a firm as large and experienced as Sainsbury s would have contingency plans in place for sick drivers or broken down vans. I have had so many bad experiences with Sainsbury s - not one of my recent orders has arrived without substitutions (annoyingly these are typically more expensive - Waitrose charge you the lower price but Sainsbury s don t).  A few years ago I was contacted on Christmas Eve to be told despite having had the order for 4 weeks  my order could not be delivered as they could not cope with demand. On that occasion following discussion with customer service someone arrived at my door with most of the order in bags from all of our local shops - an attempt to think outside the box which was appreciated despite the shambolic  poor business planning that led to it happening.  Today I was told a simple  No - we can t fulfil your order!  I will never use Sainsbury s again - Ocado  Waitrose and Morrisons manage to get their business model and professional service spot on every time. I was foolish on this occasion to be lured away from them by a good slot on Sunday morning but now regret it and will never make that mistake again.
column9: Hi Anne-Marie, I'm really sorry about your delivery experience with us. I'd like to look into this further and feed your comments back to the store. Can you PM us your account holder's name and order number please? Thanks, Allie.

column4: I am really disappointed with your Wednesfield Rookery Street car park. I was involved in an accident today whereby an elderly man drove into the side of me. There was slight damage to my car but was more concerned for the driver. He said he had recently been in hospital and acknowledged that he shouldnt have been driving. He got out to check the damage to my car and i shouted to him that the car was still rolling towards me.I didnt think at the time but i should have taken down his reg no. and contacted dvla with concerns as to whether he was fit to drive. I contacted the branch to be told the cctv only covers the front of the shop by the cashpoint and as it took place near the exit  they couldnt do anything. I just hope he got home safely. I am really disappointed that the whole of the car park is not monitored. You are ok if something happens near the entrance but Heaven forbid anything bad should happen nearer the exit as you have no chance.

column4: I am really disappointed with your Wednesfield Rookery Street car park. I was involved in an accident today whereby an elderly man drove into the side of me. There was slight damage to my car but was more concerned for the driver. He said he had recently been in hospital and acknowledged that he shouldnt have been driving. He got out to check the damage to my car and i shouted to him that the car was still rolling towards me.I didnt think at the time but i should have taken down his reg no. and contacted dvla with concerns as to whether he was fit to drive. I contacted the branch to be told the cctv only covers the front of the shop by the cashpoint and as it took place near the exit  they couldnt do anything. I just hope he got home safely. I am really disappointed that the whole of the car park is not monitored. You are ok if something happens near the entrance but Heaven forbid anything bad should happen nearer the exit as you have no chance.
column9: No I didn't as was in shock as he hadn't put the break on and the car was still rolling towards me. I was also not well after having a back op tues

column4: You send a text saying we ve updated account details  which we haven t. Call up to be told its fine the account is closed (due to previous hack) and no card details are stored. Called again to question this and told that fraud department would be in touch  but no card detailssored so should be fine.  Now 2 days later no call from fraud and £500 taken from my account for a fraudulent order.   Rude  unprofessional and incompetent  (due to the systems you have provided them) with a complete lack of respect for your customers and shocking security failings.  Told that the money might have been refunded by the store  or might not! If not the bank will return money. How dare you tell customers this and think its an acceptable level of service.  I will be reporting you to Information Commissioner for insecurely storing sensitive data and to Action Fraud for them to hopefully find a failure on your part.
column9: Your solution is for me to call the call centre that Ive already spoken to 4 times.... again? After being advised I would get a call back and told not to worry which were both incorrect.   Your contact centre has single handily undone 13 years of being a loyal customer in 3 days.   Its obvious Sainsburys dont care about service or worse are incapable of looking after their customers.

column4: I ve just had a really horrible experience at our local sainsburys in Deal  Kent. The child/buggy space I was waiting for got taken by a man with what looked like a teenage son. When I pointed out they were for parents with young children I got a mouth full. He then left to walk into town not even sainsburys. I took his reg spoke to the security guard got told to speak to customer service which I did.  They said there was nothing they could do... seriously 😠 if I d parked in a disabled space I would get a fine what about these inconsiderate drivers? At the very least they could have put a notice on his car saying they were parent bays with young children.  What is being done to deter these inconsiderate drivers?
column9: Why can't you put these spaces away from the front of the store? We only need wider spaces to get the children in and out their seats. I'm sure other parents would be happy to walk a few extra metres to the store if it meant there were spaces available and not taken up by lazy drivers not entitled to use them.

column4: I just wanted to thank the security guard at Sainsburys South Ruislip who yesterday (Thursday2nd) on seeing me attempt to steer a full trolley out of the shop one handed whilst holding my toddler (who had had enough of sitting in the trolley) offered to push the trolley. Not just out of the shop (probably to stop me knocking anything over) but all way to the car and i couldn t have parked further away. It was one of those lovely acts of kindness that don t happen too often these days but i wanted you to know how lovely your staff are. I didn t catch his name  but thank you. this reminded me of the time at the same store last year when my son had a melt down mid shop and I needed to run to the car to get something for him and the security staff were again super helpful. Thank you kind staff at Sainsburys...it s the little things that do make a difference.

column9: Susanna, are you actually reading these messages before you reply or just copying and pasting a scripted response? People are stating they have deliveries tomorrow, you saying maybe best to try tomorrow isn't helping.  I get there is an issue and you're working on it, I imagine everyone is doing all they can.  I work on SaaS solutions delivering a service to clients and we would never say something to annoy the customer further. Let people know you're working on it, you don't know how long it will take, and there's a possibility that no, it won't be fixed by their checkout time. That way people can actually plan how to get their groceries rather then get more annoyed and hound you further.

column9: Hi Steve, I've spoken with the store and I've been advised that a provisional agreement was made with ourselves and the gym to allow them to utilise the car park spaces in order to run a small office for pre-registrations. We have been able to provide this agreement as their is a health and safety requirement for the placement of the portacabin in which it needs to be a certain distances from the building works and in order to prevent trips, slips, falls or any other kind of hazards to the general public. I have been advised that one bay has been occupied by the cabin, with at least another 7 bays available for anyone who wishes to utilised the parking space. We've contacted our property team for more info on the agreement, and we'll update you here once we know more about the situtation. Ryan.

column9: Thank you for your post regarding our Moortown store car park. Anytime Fitness are set to open a new gym on the 30 June. We agreed with them that they could temporarily use part of our car park ahead of opening, in order to sign up customers interested in joining the gym. Before we made any decision we spent time monitoring how people use the car park so we could site the cabin in the best location and ensure the health and safety of all customers. This research showed that the disabled parking bays were being under-used (as the scheme is not fully let); and that the location would provide safe access for people wanting to join the gym, via the footways. This is why we have located the cabin in its current position. We do understand your concerns and will continue to monitor the situation. If we need to move the cabin to provide additional disabled parking spaces we will do so. If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact our Property Communications team on propertycommunications@sainsburys.co.uk. Faiza.

column4: I m fuming! I went into Sainsbury on Farnham Road  Slough this evening and saw two boys  about 12 years of age  riding around on scooters. They nearly collided with me and I was not happy. I approached a member of staff about it but nothing was done. I actually saw their mother laughing and chatting to another member of staff whilst the boys were on the scooters. This is anti-social  potentially dangerous and unacceptable. Why did the staff not challenge the mother? Because she is a customer? I have news for Sainsburys; I am a customer as well! I  m not a spoilsport  but there is a time a place for kids to ride scooters and it ain t whilst in a supermarket!

column4: What on earth has happened to your customer services?? My mother received an order yesterday with no wine and no cider - she rang your customer services and was told all orders are  subject to availability  - what about the inconvenience!!  This was ordered for my mother s 82nd birthday and reading various websites / forums it seems you have been unable to  provide availability  and no doubt boost your on-line sales in various areas of the country when people are unwilling to turn back the remaining items. As someone in their infinite wisdom decided to stop  click and collect  from our local store Helston - she paid a delivery fee as well. What a farce sending a van with a packet of toilet tissue  paper towel and washing powder - why not call or email and explain the alcohol was not available and did we want to cancel the order. Amazing that given our rural location we can get goods delivered from all over the world but not the 12 miles from Helston. Very very disappointed :-(

column4: Has anyone else had reason to complain about the poor quality celery on the shelves at the moment? I love to snack on celery having stopped smoking some time ago  but the present crop is awful! Very green and bitter to taste  not at all the way celery should taste  with a nutty sweet taste & creamy white colour. I believe it s because the growers have to produce so much very quickly  and do not  Blanche  the plants ie stack earth or straw around the plant to prevent photosynthesis and make the stalks white. I remember as a child this process was done with treated soot from chimneys and celery really had to be washed. No doubt the influx of central heating and some weird EU regulation make this process illegal. I am awaiting further news from Sainsbury s online team.
column9: I have home delivery from the Milton Keynes store. Barcode pic attached.

I believe it s because the growers have to produce so much very quickly  and do not  Blanche  the plants ie stack earth or straw around the plant to prevent photosynthesis and make the stalks white. I remember as a child this process was done with treated soot from chimneys and celery really had to be washed. No doubt the influx of central heating and some weird EU regulation make this process illegal. I am awaiting further news from Sainsbury s online team.
column9: Apologies about that Peter, which store have you been purchasing your celery from? Can you send us a pic of the barcode? Debs

column4: I am very disappointed today :                                                             I have shopped for many years in store - and  online with Sainsbury s for over a year for both myself & mother-in-law spending on average £140 week making our average annual around  spend 6/7 K... this week I took advantage of an offer : Sainsbury s Shiraz Vin De Pays D Oc  SO Organic 75cl  Buy any 6 or more save 25% £6.00/unit £6.00/75cl (Y) great so I ordered six   Today my order came with 5 bottle at full price  The delivery man said NO problem ma am if you ring they will refund the money  Which I did. I was very polite to the young lady and explained that i had ordered the 6 bottles at the discount of 25% and that it wasn t my fault they did not have the six in stock.  Although she was very polite she was adamant that it was company policies that they would charge the full price if they do not have the six in  stock and there was nothing she could do...  I appreciate this BUT now have gone from being a very satisfied customer to a VERY UNSATISFIED customer ...  I will NOT be shopping with Sainsbury s from now on and will take my 6/7 k a year elsewhere  Thank you! Merice :3
column9: Seems that they are on this ""scam"" all over the country. Like you we (and all our friends / neighbours etc) will be shopping elsewhere in future.

column4: Well done Sainsburys what a brilliant way to get thousands of new home delivery customers (did you pay martin lewis to do the advertising bit) So - the deal was get your prosecco for around £4 according to martin lewis - and the deal was -   6 x bottles of taste the difference reduced from 10 to £7.50 then with an extra 25% off as you buying 6  then sign up as new customer and get an extra £20 off your order  (didnt actually say you need to get your order to over £100 in value though!) Anyway thought it was good offer - signed up as newby  added the 6 bottles of prosecco then added double the normal amount of toilet rolls and bleach to get the order to the £100!! Processed the order no problem.   Day before the delivery decided to add something on - problem wouldnt let me check out again so called your customer services -  oh yes if its the prosecco it was a mistake you cant actually have both offers so you couldnt have the 25% off the £7.50 bottlles!!! Hmmm ok well it let me the first time!   No the driver would have told you when he turned up!!  Why dont you try a different prosecco on the 25% off offer?    - Ok so i picked another one and to make the order up to the 100 again as it was less i ordered 12 bottles this time (Im not an alcoholic summers coming!)  Ok she said  the only thing is im not sure the £20 off new customer offer applies if the order includes alcohol!!!!   Really?? Anyway couldnt find anywhere in the small print it didnt so we went ahead and processed the order this time without problem but with a different prosecco! So tonight the delivery turns up -   Oh theres a change on there he says  -  You ordered 12 x bottles - they only sent 2 (obviously back to the full price as 25% off only applies to 6)  - there were no alternatives so none of the wine on the 25% off was available then? Now ive ordered a lot of shopping that is a lot more expensive than my usual shop at another supermarket for absolutley nothing! Feel out of pocket and conned!!!!!!!
column9: Did they fix this for you ?,

Just want to say a HUGE thank you to the delivery driver that stopped to help my mum last night between Pickering and the Hole of Horcum.  She pulled over to check her fog lights were working  left the keys in the car and one of our naughty little dogs managed to press the lock button inside the car locking her out!! And locking her phone in the car.  Numerous people drove past and didn t stop  the only person who stopped was one of your delivery drivers  what a true gentleman! They eventually managed to contact my dad to sort out a spare key - but then the dogs decided to unlock the car and let her back in again. Amazing work from your staff  going above and beyond to help a lady by herself (who was most likely hysterical 😂) Thank you so much! Would love it if in anyway possible this feedback could be passed to the drivers  and then the guy would know how much we appreciated his help.
column9: Woohoo! That's what we like to hear. Would it be possible to find out the order number? That way we can feed this back to the correct team. Chris.

column4: Hi to who it my concern. I went  to the West Hendon Sainsburys in North West London on the 23rd of May to buy a tub of baby milk from birth (Aptamil Reflex and regurgitation) but I mistakenly bought Cowgate 1 first infant milk. The tub was still sealed and is still not open. I still have the receipt. However I went back to the store and customer service said they can  not process any refunds or exchanges on baby formula. Please get in contact ASAP.

column4: Sainsbury - What is going on with your pickers and delivery people ?? Today is the final straw . Ordered three different desserts   one has to be used by today and two by tomorrow despite my delivery being between 5-30  6.30 pm today!   We have already had our meal for this evening prior to delivery.  In addition ordered frozen haddock which arrived all crushed & broken.   Did I phone to complain ... NO because I had to phone post last delivery and I have no intention of phoning you after each delivery   I do not have the time or the inclination . It will be easier for me to stop shopping with you as I find this unacceptable !   Are we supposed to eat all the food as soon as it arrives ? Same applies to susges & burgers   both must be eaten by tomorrow ... Please educate your pickers and don t unload your last minute use by date foods on your customers ! I have shopped with Sainsbury for years but I have really had enough now & will shop with Waitrose &Tesco in future as your standards have greatly dropped .
column9: NO , it wasn't .

column4: I broke a square white china JS bowl and thought I would open an online account to get a replacement. No store locally stocks them. BIG MISTAKE!!! I had to make up £100 order for my £3 bowl and gave up at £40. Delivery arrived (thanks Andrew) with paper plate substitues. What fool who picked my order thinks this is remotely useful. Contacted Customer services yesterday who said another close(ish) store would contact me. No messages so far and still waiting.... Waitrose here we come.....
column9: Sorry Neil, products online are subject to availability. Could you PM your order number and the name on the account? I'll have a look into this for you. Leigh

column9: The order number is: 38024323 and the account name is Dr Neil Towers. What you mean is subject to stock availability at the store that picks my order? Not stock availability with visibility across Sainsbury's overall stock system. You will see I also ordered two other plates in the same set. All three substitutes were packs of 10 paper plates. Just as well I wasn't banking on the delivery for a dinner party...  It would have been more helpful to find the crockery I ordered from the Sainsbury's stock and deliver the items to my local store in Cheltenham for a later collection. Better customer service, no?  Neil

column4: Sainsbury s I cannot believe that in rebranding your free from range you have changed the recipe of your free from flapjack. This was previously a gluten and dairy free snack that my son eats every single day. Not only does he have bowel disease restricting what he can eat but he has problems controlling his blood sugars. The flapjack is literally part of his treatment plan to provide slow release oat carbohydrates. You have decided to rebrand it as  all butter  now containing milk and so my son cannot eat this  I m really disappointed and thought it was a fantastic product that did not need milk adding.
column9: I'm really sorry your son can't eat it any more. Is this the right product? - http://bit.ly/24iSpL6. Could you also tell me which store you usually shop in? Leigh
